In some cases yum repositories are using priorities configuration
to force OpenStack packages to be installed from the desired
repository.

To work properly, priorities configuration requires the package
yum-plugin-priorities to be installed before doing the actual
OpenStack packages installation.

This patch adds yum-plugin-priorities in pre-install phase for

tripleo images.

commit_message:
Install yum-plugin-priorities in pre-install phase

In some cases yum repositories are using priorities configuration
to force OpenStack packages to be installed from the desired
repository.

To work properly, priorities configuration requires the package
yum-plugin-priorities to be installed before doing the actual
OpenStack packages installation.

This patch adds yum-plugin-priorities in pre-install phase for
overcloud-base element wich is always used when creating
tripleo images.

Change-Id: I9c9b50d35d411f85a4cbe33ffab4c71d40dfb0f1
Closes-Bug: #1740934
Closes-Bug: #1727985
(cherry picked from commit cc606ef52757adb438639f736bb505d4ffd2c56b)

yum-plugin-priorities should not be enabled on RHEL

Change-Id: Ic3721f0fbd35eb421d439e53ff8418293f83d4af
(cherry picked from commit 82d0a62d85fafae218414d551191dc1fd3f639d5)

commit_message:
Switch static ansible inventory to yaml format

This is needed so we can represent complex data types e.g lists/maps
in the vars, which is difficult with the current ini format.

tripleo-ansible-inventory now supports --static-yaml-inventory, and
the old format is deprecated, so switch these uses to the new CLI.

Change-Id: I19c3877c0de8553715508a9dacc2ef145935af89

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I65e1e4d40fbd56c7e2f7e4a59c0438d7176c36b4

commit_message:
Fix volume attach error in generic driver

The generic driver doesn't understand the new 'reserved'
volume state and errors out when it detects that state.

Closes-Bug: #1741568

Change-Id: Ic14186d47b4d16a03c5c1e52933be5fa4660ee28

commit_message:
Ignore directory .stestr

After running the functional tests, this directory shows up. I don't
know what's in it, but I'm fairly certain I don't want to commit it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-29 21:22:24.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Use a non admin privileges for retyping a volume"

This reverts commit f5869b4557855af9450501c65e03bd16fd269036.

When retyping a volume, it is possible that Cinder falls back to migrating a volume in order to complete the retype which is admin-only operation.

This will result in a failure because Cinder will attempt to contact Nova using the credentials of the user which are not elevated, with Nova refusing to do the volume swap.

Therefore, in order to effectively test this, we should stick to using the admin API as a retype can require a migration which is an admin-only operation.

Change-Id: I3e4853146bb6e2a62205ffe690da081229215f54
'}, {'created': '2017-12-29 21:23:02.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Use a non admin privileges for retyping a volume"

commit_message:
Revert "Use a non admin privileges for retyping a volume"

This reverts commit f5869b4557855af9450501c65e03bd16fd269036.

When retyping a volume, it is possible that Cinder falls back to
migrating a volume in order to complete the retype which is admin-only
operation.

This will result in a failure because Cinder will attempt to contact
Nova using the credentials of the user which are not elevated, with
Nova refusing to do the volume swap.

Therefore, in order to effectively test this, we should stick to using
the admin API as a retype can require a migration which is an
admin-only operation.

Related-Bug: #1740544
Change-Id: I3e4853146bb6e2a62205ffe690da081229215f54

commit_message:
L3: prevent associating a FIP to a DHCP port

We should not allow a floating IP to be assigned to a DHCP port.

Change-Id: I6bf940b6e9195dc7d99e13fbe4454b08488cab0f
Closes-bug: #1739071

This dynamically adds the elasticsearch path.repo configuration
entry if it's not defined.  This solves issues arising when the
storage settings are disabled in favor of emptydirs for simpler
ES deployments.  If elasticsearch attempts to configure the repo

"}]
commit_message:
Fix elasticsearch repository configuration entry

This dynamically adds the elasticsearch path.repo configuration
entry if it's not defined.  This solves issues arising when the
storage settings are disabled in favor of emptydirs for simpler
ES deployments.  If elasticsearch attempts to configure the repo
path with an invalid entry (inaccesible external or shared fs
path), the service will crash.

Change-Id: I089b77104107dfb1f8e6ea2d8a560384718e63f9

commit_message:
Perserve env variables

This patch set adds in -E flag for ``sudo pip install`` so
any environment variable is preserved for the install.  This
allows for some proxy-related variables such as ``http_proxy``
to pass through for pip.

This mirrors the change in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531270/1

Change-Id: Ib513fce862f31d784634645ac6b038c6a35f4cd6

commit_message:
Ceph: don't overwrite mon map

When monmap is persisted, don't overwrite it when mon pod restarts.
This helps when there is just one mon or all mons reboot

Change-Id: I9119379f4bc026c315a2fa7507a1664b12ea6205
Signed-off-by: Huamin Chen <hchen@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 23:45:18.000000000', 'message': "Add policy for multiattach

This adds a policy for multiattach as well as checks in create
and retype.  The retype changes also include the necessary steps
to ensure the volume is in avaialable state before allowing
changes to multiattach.

Currently if you try and do this even with the proper policy
settings you'll never get a valid host from the scheduler.

The proper entry for the type/extra-spec is:
{multiattach: <is True>}

Once backends are added and report the capability scheduling will
complete.

Change-Id: I212664bd13d298352227bad4d12120b677619525
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 23:49:32.000000000', 'message': "Add policy for multiattach

This adds a policy for multiattach as well as checks in create
and retype.  The retype changes also include the necessary steps
to ensure the volume is in avaialable state before allowing
changes to multiattach.

This patch also marks the --allow-multiattach flag to create
as deprecated.

Currently if you try and do this even with the proper policy
settings you'll never get a valid host from the scheduler.

The proper entry for the type/extra-spec is:
{multiattach: <is True>}

Once backends are added and report the capability scheduling will
complete.

Change-Id: I212664bd13d298352227bad4d12120b677619525
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach
"}]
commit_message:
Add policy for multiattach

This adds a policy for multiattach as well as checks in create
and retype.  The retype changes also include the necessary steps
to ensure the volume is in avaialable state before allowing
changes to multiattach.

This patch also marks the --allow-multiattach flag to create
as deprecated.

Currently if you try and do this even with the proper policy
settings you'll never get a valid host from the scheduler.

The proper entry for the type/extra-spec is:
{multiattach: <is True>}

Once backends are added and report the capability scheduling will
complete.

Change-Id: I212664bd13d298352227bad4d12120b677619525
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach

commit_message:
Upgrades job not finding featureset file.

The content of the  variable $FEATURESET_FILE
has changed, containing now the whole path
to the featureset env file.

Change-Id: Ie35b7055259866e0044c31502c47711e3c7d8d4a

commit_message:
Fix docs syntax for OVB jobs

Fix syntax for documentation creating in featuresets files,
config items should be lists, not strings.

Change-Id: I9baa51b13df3663ce6b112c7fa93fa03ae0b4a79

commit_message:
Adjust TripleoInventory arguments, don't pass config object

Instead pass the individual named parameters, which is clearer
and easier for tests, particularly now that some of these are
optional.

Change-Id: Ic49cccdcd900e0ca97d1f6c4675e865e6357363d

commit_message:
Rerun inventory before collect-logs

If the overcloud deploy times out, we don't currently get logs from
overcloud nodes because we never got to the task that adds them to the
ansible inventory.

This patch addresses that by always rebuilding the dynamic inventory as
the first task in the collect-logs playbook.

Partial-Bug:# 1738038

Change-Id: I7bf7733ed93179d15f287513d8031223d3966cc1

commit_message:
Only create config-download.yaml for multinode

This environment is not needed when using ovb. It sets a HostnameMap and
DeployedServerPortMap, which are needed only for multinode.

Change-Id: I559cdac2ce3a64ca374055abf81bfc891b451e83

[{'created': '2018-01-02 20:33:33.000000000', 'message': "update releasing doc links for zuul v3

As part of the migration to zuul v3, a few of the links have changed.
In particular:
- The periodic job failure rate in grafana is now panel 6, not 4.
- The periodic logs are no longer in a single location and thus
can't be referenced with a single link.

This patch fixes up those issues.

Change-Id: Ifb60cebab4b9a2e61a15f21f9cb4fc13d52975ee
"}]
commit_message:
update releasing doc links for zuul v3

As part of the migration to zuul v3, a few of the links have changed.
In particular:
- The periodic job failure rate in grafana is now panel 6, not 4.
- The periodic logs are no longer in a single location and thus
can't be referenced with a single link.

This patch fixes up those issues.

Change-Id: Ifb60cebab4b9a2e61a15f21f9cb4fc13d52975ee

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-14 09:52:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

From what I do understand, if you want to put proxies on controllers it means that you will have to open the QEMU process to listen externally where I'm not sure whether that is really safe."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-09-14 15:26:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> From what I do understand, if you want to put proxies on
 > controllers it means that you will have to open the QEMU process to
 > listen externally where I'm not sure whether that is really safe.

You are right that it's not secure -- there has been a proposal [1] for a long time to add encryption between the proxy and the compute node.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443234/"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-09-14 15:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-09-20 17:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

What I was trying to say is that deployments are presently running console proxies outside of compute nodes. You are right that there are security issues with that, which is why there is a spec and patches up to add TLS encryption to that connection.

Because console proxies do not run on the compute node, we need to store the access_url_base in the database so the console proxy can access it. Currently it's stored in the oslo.cache (formerly memcached). This series is changing the backend from oslo.cache to the database, so we need to store the access_url_base in the database.

I hope that makes sense."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-09-21 21:01:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Here's the documentation that explains the deployment of console proxies:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/remote-console-access.html#typical-deployment"}, {'account_id': 7461, 'date': '2017-10-03 15:22:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

sorry for the fly-by comment, don't look at this stuff anymore. 

Sahid, if the proxy is on the compute node you have to allow internet access to the compute node or the user cannot reach the proxy. Proxies are usually put on controller hosts, usually the same host as the API, and shared across compute nodes. So there is not one proxy per compute node.

The config for access_url_base is per-compute node because deployments may use different proxies for different compute nodes for scale, load balancing, HA or network separation.

Cloud deployments that care about security of the connection between proxy and compute node use network routing + firewalls etc. to mitigate risk."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-10-03 16:58:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I think this must have fallen off of sahid's radar, but given the documentation to the contrary, I think it's clear that the proxy runs (or at least is recommended to run) on a non-compute host. So let's get this going."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-03 18:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Yes I just noticed the responses of Melanie and Paul. I made mistake saying that the proxies are on compute. I expected take time tomorrow to look at it deeper since I have the feeling that if we have to store the 'access_url_base', the design is perhaps not good or something is wrong. But feel free to by-pass my thinking."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-04 15:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Unfortunately this column was missed off when console_auth_tokens

The access_url is needed for a protocol check in the console proxies.
Console proxies run globally per cell and do not run on compute hosts
and thus do not have access to the access_url config options in the
compute hosts nova.conf files.

So, we need to store part of the access_url in the database. We cannot
store the entire access_url because it contains the unhashed token, but
we can keep the base part of the url and generate the full access_url
on demand. An access url base looks something like this:

  http://127.0.0.1:6080/vnc_auto.html

and using it, we can generate the full access_url on demand for the
protocol check in the console proxies.

commit_message:
Add access_url_base to console_auth_tokens table

Unfortunately this column was missed off when console_auth_tokens
was added to the database. This change adds it in.

The access_url is needed for a protocol check in the console proxies.
Console proxies run per cell and do not run on compute hosts and thus
do not have access to the access_url config options in the compute
hosts nova.conf files.

So, we need to store part of the access_url in the database. We cannot
store the entire access_url because it contains the unhashed token, but
we can keep the base part of the url and generate the full access_url
on demand. An access url base looks something like this:

  http://127.0.0.1:6080/vnc_auto.html

and using it, we can generate the full access_url on demand for the
protocol check in the console proxies.

partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: I0f672f5667d42b67d869ff9f467dbb64eb6c9ff9

commit_message:
Fix unit tests around oslo::logging

As we've moved the log configuration to leverage oslo::logging, we need
to make sure that the unit tests are properly updated to reflect how
we're calling it. Previously we were checking that the tempest_config
value was set but this changed in oslo::logging which broke the unit
tests.

Change-Id: I4ea645fdf0d9630e3589619f6127ae8046a92c85

wait, the reason why the client profile has this same check [1] is that when it's colocated with a monitor, it has to be the monitor profile to create the keys because it also injects them into the cluster while the client profile does not

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/profile/client.pp#L28"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-11 12:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> wait, the reason why the client profile has this same check [1] is
 > that when it's colocated with a monitor, it has to be the monitor
 > profile to create the keys because it also injects them into the
 > cluster while the client profile does not
 > 
 > 1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/profile/client.pp#L28

This comes up in the following case however: 

 https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1722633

If the client instantiates the keys instead of the Mon, then is that a problem? If so, perhaps the solution is to ensure the Mon does it first by defining an ordering instead."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-10-11 13:02:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If the client instantiates the keys instead of the Mon, then is
 > that a problem?

yes because ::mon is using different defaults then ::client [1], because ::mon can inject keys into the cluster while ::client can't

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/profile/mon.pp#L42"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-01-06 15:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update Mon profile to not declare Ceph keys if already defined

The Client profile already has the same proposed check.

Change-Id: Ia343d314589da1a771944bb6376f8767479c2489
Closes-Bug: #1722633

commit_message:
Add support for listing hosts in cellv2

Add a ``nova-manage cell_v2 list_hosts`` command for listing hosts
in one or all v2 cells.

Change-Id: Ie8eaa8701aafac10e030568107b8e6255a60434d
Closes-Bug: #1735687

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 16:29:55.000000000', 'message': 'validate-tempest: better workers default

tempest_workers used `ansible_processor_count` which is in fact the
number of physical CPUs - rarely more than two nowadays - when it should
in fact use number of CPU cores/threads which is `ansible_processor_vcpus`.

Change-Id: I7aa0dd29df5130e15bf6c1cf97774744e2f46921
'}]
commit_message:
validate-tempest: better workers default

tempest_workers used `ansible_processor_count` which is in fact the
number of physical CPUs - rarely more than two nowadays - when it should
in fact use number of CPU cores/threads which is `ansible_processor_vcpus`.

Change-Id: I7aa0dd29df5130e15bf6c1cf97774744e2f46921

commit_message:
manager: more detailed info of unsupported compute driver

get_all_bw_counters is only implementd by xen api.
We should give more detailed info of drivers
if get_all_bw_counters not implemented.

Also improved the related unit tests for log checking.

Change-Id: Idb4aa771fda3972b64e3412a60ac475468e007d0
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

commit_message:
Refactor sending netmiko config commands

Extracts the sending of netmiko configuration commands into a separate
method.  This allows subclasses to implement as necessary.

Change-Id: I8eea36c5ae93230df6c626a0ac9e2225d8f2da0e
Related-Bug: #1740587

commit_message:
Set heat engine workers to "%{::os_workers_heat_engine}"

This should be a better setting for large baremetal environments where
using the default #CPUs setting can consume too much memory.

Note the fact added in I31d02bea6dd55d65a7014503398adc4422ce7303 is used,
this will chose a value similarly to os_workers fact but changing the 
minimum from 2 to 4 as we know 2 doesn't work well for heat/tripleo.

This is a partial revert of 34ec2644284d59c0e07f2c4729cd354a37928aae

Change-Id: I0283ef092559fdf9b46c0b04a7d9f4f934ed4fbd
Closes-Bug: #1739030

commit_message:
IPSEC: stop relying on cloning the repository from t-h-t

Since the ansible-tripleo-ipsec package is now available and
tripleo-heat-templates relies on it, we no longer need to clone
the tripleo-ipsec repo as part of the ansible tasks.

Change-Id: I513f748abeaee6589829e1d45483db9a7e7791ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-02 16:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'fs032: switch to extra_args

Configure 3nodes-multinode specific environments with extra_args
interface and not multinode_args.

The problem if we override multinode_args is that we have to
re-configure all parameters from featureset-multinode-common.yml and if
one is missing, the default will be taken.
In the case of featureset032, deploy_multinode was set to False while we
need it to True, to pass  --overcloud-ssh-user when deploying the
overcloud.

So this patch will just pass the 3nodes-specific arguments via
extra_args interface, and rely on featureset-multinode-common.yml for
the other parameters like the rest of multinode jobs.

Change-Id: I7b25cac1f13067832374dba2023fdc8044cc5587
'}, {'created': '2018-01-02 16:50:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing --overcloud-ssh-user parameter

--overcloud-ssh-user is needed on multinode jobs.
Since 3nodes-multinode override multinode_args, we need to keep the same
arguments needed from:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/9449198547dcdd4cf15d6a7a7e8671becb055d2f/roles/overcloud-deploy/tasks/pre-deploy.yml#L205-L210

Change-Id: I7b25cac1f13067832374dba2023fdc8044cc5587
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing --overcloud-ssh-user parameter

--overcloud-ssh-user is needed on multinode jobs.
Since 3nodes-multinode override multinode_args, we need to keep the same
arguments needed from:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/9449198547dcdd4cf15d6a7a7e8671becb055d2f/roles/overcloud-deploy/tasks/pre-deploy.yml#L205-L210

Change-Id: I7b25cac1f13067832374dba2023fdc8044cc5587

commit_message:
Stop services before upgrade only before Pike

Stopping the openstack, neutron and httpd services is
now executed within instack when executing 'openstack
undercloud upgrade' [0]

However, for backwards compatibility reasons we still
need to stop them when upgrading to a previous version.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/479081/

Change-Id: I5acd2b08b286071f3628617206d75574044adcb5

[{'created': '2018-01-04 15:54:09.000000000', 'message': "fs017: stop running test_volume_boot_pattern

Boot from volume is already covered by
test_encrypted_cinder_volumes_cryptsetup in Barbican testing.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/tree/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_volume_encryption.py#n99

Let's save almost 5 minutes by not running this test:
http://logs.openstack.org/15/531015/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container/6067c30/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tempest_output.log.txt.gz#_2018-01-03_23_52_57

Change-Id: If8f791a5fda48e617205456f0ab65fc19d372293
"}]
commit_message:
fs017: stop running test_volume_boot_pattern

Boot from volume is already covered by
test_encrypted_cinder_volumes_cryptsetup in Barbican testing.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/tree/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_volume_encryption.py#n99

Let's save almost 5 minutes by not running this test:
http://logs.openstack.org/15/531015/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container/6067c30/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tempest_output.log.txt.gz#_2018-01-03_23_52_57

Change-Id: If8f791a5fda48e617205456f0ab65fc19d372293

commit_message:
Reorganize the content of horizon project tab

The volume was removed form 'compute' tab, and the floating ip
is in network tab, and so on. So this patch reorganize the content
of the project tab.

Change-Id: Ifb35910f21f2593b9e6f30ac50092118a6f0bac6

commit_message:
Enable barbican keystone listener

The barbican keystone listener has been added to the same pod
as the barbican api.  Need to set some barbican config to enable it.

Also set a specific topic for barbican_notifications so that
we do not compete with other services.

Change-Id: I5f7e4d2367b9776a1b7e74d1727472e1f81f509a

Remove keyintries=1 from node-to-node template

Using that was prone to errors, since a temporary issue could screw
the setting up of the tunnels.

os-net-config always logs the message "Using mapping file at:
/etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml" even if the file does not exist, in
which case it's not actually being used at all. Move the log message to
only be shown if the mapping file actually exists and is used.

commit_message:
Only log that mapping file is in use if it's actually true

os-net-config always logs the message "Using mapping file at:
/etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml" even if the file does not exist, in
which case it's not actually being used at all. Move the log message to
only be shown if the mapping file actually exists and is used.

In the case where no mapping file is used, also log a message indicating
such.

Change-Id: Iea46e215d531e0fed5839c28c116417db464d52d
Closes-Bug: #1737191

commit_message:
Use INFO log level for getting nics

Getting the ordered, active, and available nics has been traditionally
one of the parts of os-net-config that can cause issues due to either
user error or bugs. There are helpful log messages to log what is going
on in the logic, but it's all hidden behind the DEBUG log level.

These messages should be INFO instead of DEBUG. It's much more user
friendly when there are issues instead of having to rerun with --debug.

Change-Id: I7d9fd87bcbba87ecef4fedcb2b6e8dd48c3e610e
Closes-Bug: #1737196

commit_message:
Log any exceptions that occur in the tripleo.plan.update_from_dir action

Previously the action would return a string representation of the
exception. It will be unlikely that this would contain enough
information, so it is useful to log the full exception traceback.

Change-Id: Ibb5438470f7c4843c59a03640909bb82623f4046

commit_message:
puppet apply: add --summarize

... so we can know how long take resources configuration in Puppet
catalogs, and more easily debug why we have timeouts.

Change-Id: If3fae8837140caae91120e46b4880146ffe22afc

commit_message:
add env for ci.centos to turn off tempest

ci.centos can not run tempest. This creates
a default config for ci.centos where we use
only ping.

Closes-Bug: #1741130
Change-Id: I5449adb336b7bf88559b0202218f365ae40b87c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-27 15:13:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add MinPoll and MaxPoll options to NTP module

These options specify the minimum and maximum poll intervals
for NTP messages, in seconds to the power of two.

The maximum poll interval defaults to 10 (1,024 s), but can be
increased by the MaxPoll option to an upper limit of 17 (36.4 h).
The minimum poll interval defaults to 6 (64 s), but can be decreased
by the MinPoll option to a lower limit of 4 (16 s).

Change-Id: Ib2929be86e8cb31c00d166abe750354188302415
Closes-bug: #1736170
'}]
commit_message:
Add MinPoll and MaxPoll options to NTP module

These options specify the minimum and maximum poll intervals
for NTP messages, in seconds to the power of two.

The maximum poll interval defaults to 10 (1,024 s), but can be
increased by the MaxPoll option to an upper limit of 17 (36.4 h).
The minimum poll interval defaults to 6 (64 s), but can be decreased
by the MinPoll option to a lower limit of 4 (16 s).

Change-Id: Ib2929be86e8cb31c00d166abe750354188302415
Closes-bug: #1736170

tempest plugin. All content from the
ironic_inspector/test/inspector_tempest_plugin/ directory has been
ported to that project.

We no longer want to have the plugin content stored here so we can
now delete it.

commit_message:
Remove ironic_inspector/test/inspector_tempest_plugin/ directory

We now use the project openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin to store our
tempest plugin. All content from the
ironic_inspector/test/inspector_tempest_plugin/ directory has been
ported to that project.

We no longer want to have the plugin content stored here so we can
now delete it.

Change-Id: Ia8ea3a74d5aba1ea27eb6715c21667a30bac56b4

commit_message:
Add expired_at_int column to trusts

We've already converted Password objects to use the DateTimeInt format
for its datetime attributes[1]. This was necessary to cope with
differences in date storage formats between different DBMSs that was
causing intermittent test failures. While we're not experiencing those
CI problems any more, the DateTimeInt format is the way forward for
consistent datetime storage. This patch converts the trust table and
model to use the new format.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/493259/

Related-bug: #1702211

Change-Id: If524c743170924e5b8cfdafa862ed31b06db018c

Hi mr.Kong,
I meet the same problem with this when upgrade kubernetes from 2.0.0 to 4.0.0. So, I want to ask you how can I do it without change to cotyledon.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-01-06 00:24:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Hi mr.Kong,
 > I meet the same problem with this when upgrade kubernetes from
 > 2.0.0 to 4.0.0. So, I want to ask you how can I do it without
 > change to cotyledon.

Unfortunately, I didn't find any other solutions, i have tried to use a customized upper-constraints file, but i took a look at the devstack script, it is hardcoded to use the file in openstack/requirements repo. I also found the same issue in taskflow project, they chose to use futures module instead of multiprocessing module. So, seems there is no better solution unless avoid using eventlet."}]

commit_message:
Support kubernetes python client 4.0.0

From 4.0.0, kubernetes-incubator/client-python uses multiprocessing
libaray to send request to k8s cluster, which is not supported by
eventlet. This patch introduced the following changes to fix the issue:

- Use cotyledon for engine service rather than oslo.service
- Update global requirments
- Provide separate scripts for api and engine service

References:
[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/147
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/taskflow/+bug/1225275

Change-Id: Ib99565e00eedc72c388e8ebec6b7f1453f77f30f

commit_message:
Fix the network subnets check in create instance form

If a project is only one available network, we need to verify
whether it contains subnets, otherwise nova api will return
"Network f1a03328-60d0-4b0e-a4a0-d25ec0d185c4 requires
a subnet in order to boot instances on. (HTTP 400)"

The default network may not contain subnets[1]. We should first
query the networks that contains the subnets, and then get the
default network from the networks.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js#L478-#L484

Change-Id: I16f7f8cddf045445ed026f62366957de9d289c03
Closes-Bug: #1686449

commit_message:
Rework getting limits and requests for containers

It is not unusual to have containers that do not have limits and
requests set so we should treat that more graceful and not throw
exceptions in that case

Change-Id: I2a88395f82cabe3f84e22c67ef795b4389e2e7bf

commit_message:
Create artifacts dir regardless of afs rpm builds

We don't always create afs rpms in our periodic job so we were skipping
the creation of the artifacts dir. Unfortunately the openstack
artifact publishing playbook expects this dir to exist. Fix this by
creating the artifacts dir but not populating it with RPMs if we didn't
build any RPMs for openafs.

Change-Id: I986bca765ae898e9792e789c6852bce1d654d580

commit_message:
Add --static-yaml-inventory option to tripleo-ansible-inventory

This allows dumping a static inventory in yaml format, which makes
representing vars containing complex data types, e.g lists/maps easier
than with ini format (which only supports string values).

This also makes use of the tripleo-common class that now supports
writing a yaml format static inventory, so we deprecate the old code
and CLI option for later removal.

Change-Id: I38b9e17ef7981c22850b17d7bb8396c8db3a1b0a

commit_message:
Fix initialization of auth token AuthProtocol

AuthProtocol expects the conf paramter to be in the form
{"oslo_config_config": cfg.CONF} if you want to use your own oslo config
object. This change ensures we init AuthProtocol with the right form of
configuration.

Change-Id: I7f8abf200c6fcbf83c5a7d5c867fdb56d95923c3

subject: Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-01-05 17:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-05 17:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-05 17:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 17:44:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1cfecc39dc37a01bbaea114773397c062367ae42)
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 17:53:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1cfecc39dc37a01bbaea114773397c062367ae42)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1cfecc39dc37a01bbaea114773397c062367ae42)

The mode is able to serve all roles and nodes, so there is no need to
complicate setup by using a different mode per node.

commit_message:
configure-vbmc: get user id/name from the current user

The user on the virthost is not necessary the same than non_root_user.
This patch simplify the logic and rely directely on the current user and
 its id to build the virsh path.

commit_message:
Retry _trait_sync on deadlock

We're seeing DBDeadlock failures during scheduling in CI jobs
when syncing traits when getting allocation candidates.

We have a lock around this code but that's not going to carry across
multiple processes, so we need to be able to retry on deadlock if
one occurs.

Change-Id: I6cf1793c1cbed18d850ec7e32b5b195e78cb4e68
Closes-Bug: #1738083
(cherry picked from commit c66ae65775bb9d885fac059847063fee70617bc5)

commit_message:
Add scope_types to role policies

Normal role references should be considered `system` scoped. Domain
roles are considered `project` and `system` scoped.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used to manage roles. Operators will have the option to require
system-scoped tokens for these policies by enabling oslo.policy's
`enforce_scope` configuration option, which will result in an
HTTP Forbidden exception when mismatching scope is used.

Change-Id: I6eb2bb9f251e0d36163a0baf788bcc9ef440ded2

commit_message:
Log radvd config contents on reload when debug is on

This may help to understand whether L3 agent correctly configured the
daemon.

Change-Id: I741e5cbf2db19ccf3aab814200e736d41140b4f0

[{'created': '2017-11-10 22:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'When deleting port, refresh fixed_ips on retry

Otherwise we risk seeing same IP addresses on each retry despite some
may be added / removed between retry attempts (f.e. when a new subnet
is created).

Related-Bug: #1706750

Change-Id: I259248039bacce995c476f81d1076b22c7256009
'}]
commit_message:
When deleting port, refresh fixed_ips on retry

Otherwise we risk seeing same IP addresses on each retry despite some
may be added / removed between retry attempts (f.e. when a new subnet
is created).

Related-Bug: #1706750

Change-Id: I259248039bacce995c476f81d1076b22c7256009

commit_message:
VMware: add support for different firmwares

Add support for explicitly requiring UEFI or BIOS firmware from
images by taking hw_firmware_type metadata into account.

blueprint vmware-boot-uefi

Change-Id: Ibfb57c55569e430a846003472a49a536e94e6a48

subject: Read .ini files when --config-dir used
messages:
[{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-03-17 18:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-03-17 18:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Which projects are using INI files?'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-03-17 18:59:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It should noted that lots of projects use api-paste.ini in their conf dir, without expecting oslo.config to load them. We need to make sure that it doesn't break them."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-17 19:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-oslo.config-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-docs-ubuntu-xenial/8c0a60e//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 57s

- gate-oslo.config-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python27-ubuntu-xenial/a5b2162/ : SUCCESS in 3m 35s
- gate-oslo.config-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python35/b2e9456/ : SUCCESS in 2m 10s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial/ca4c2e7/ : SUCCESS in 1h 13m 46s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-newton http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-newton/1226a2e/ : FAILURE in 19m 53s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-ocata http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-ocata/5c9d6ee/ : FAILURE in 12m 52s
- gate-oslo.config-releasenotes http://docs-draft.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-releasenotes/e41e715//releasenotes/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 36s'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-03-17 21:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I mentioned neutron in commit message'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-03-20 13:19:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It should noted that lots of projects use api-paste.ini in their
 > conf dir, without expecting oslo.config to load them. We need to
 > make sure that it doesn't break them.

I have same concern about api-paste.ini, which is common case in many porjects like Nova."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-03-20 13:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > It should noted that lots of projects use api-paste.ini in their
 > > conf dir, without expecting oslo.config to load them. We need to
 > > make sure that it doesn't break them.

 > I have same concern about api-paste.ini, which is common case in
 > many porjects like Nova.

And they pass --config-dir to /etc/nova?"}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-03-22 12:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-22 14:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo.config-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-docs-ubuntu-xenial/03bb307//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 57s
- gate-oslo.config-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/1ee3fe9/ : SUCCESS in 3m 13s
- gate-oslo.config-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python27-ubuntu-xenial/22a43bc/ : SUCCESS in 2m 58s
- gate-oslo.config-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python35/a535110/ : SUCCESS in 2m 10s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial/bf5c2d1/ : SUCCESS in 1h 03m 14s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-newton http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-newton/c923a6a/ : FAILURE in 14m 11s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-ocata http://logs.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config-ubuntu-xenial-ocata/61f9be1/ : FAILURE in 14m 01s (non-voting)
- gate-oslo.config-releasenotes http://docs-draft.openstack.org/95/447095/1/check/gate-oslo.config-releasenotes/a9c80fc//releasenotes/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 03s'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-03-29 14:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> > > It should noted that lots of projects use api-paste.ini in
 > their
 > > > conf dir, without expecting oslo.config to load them. We need
 > to
 > > > make sure that it doesn't break them.
 > >
 > > I have same concern about api-paste.ini, which is common case in
 > > many porjects like Nova.
 > 
 > And they pass --config-dir to /etc/nova?

I don't think so, Nova maybe use --config-dir as neutron plan to use it, my concern is that this change also blocks projects like Nova to use --config-dir in the future and may break projects which have used --config-dir and with .ini files."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-03-30 15:24:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From a backwards-compatibility perspective, we would only have a problem if an INI file contained options using the same name as those for an application, but not intended to be used by the application, or if the file is incompatible with our parser. It should be possible to load something like paste.ini safely because the contents of the file are ignored until an application tries to access the configuration option value.

That said, I'm still unsure this is a good idea. I would like to understand why those neutron services are using .ini instead of .conf for their configuration files. And which platforms (or deployment tools) caused that."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-03-30 18:26:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> That said, I'm still unsure this is a good idea. I would like to
 > understand why those neutron services are using .ini instead of
 > .conf for their configuration files. And which platforms (or
 > deployment tools) caused that.

They do it probably by mistake, and because Neutron core gave them a wrong idea about the correct naming (we have plenty of .ini files for Neutron agents). Now, the question is whether we want to adopt to those practices, or force everyone to rename their files.

I don't insist on the change. If you think it's not worth it, folks always have a workaround of creating symlinks with .conf extensions. (Some RDO packages for networking-* actually do just that.)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-03-30 18:33:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > That said, I'm still unsure this is a good idea. I would like to
 > > understand why those neutron services are using .ini instead of
 > > .conf for their configuration files. And which platforms (or
 > > deployment tools) caused that.
 > 
 > They do it probably by mistake, and because Neutron core gave them
 > a wrong idea about the correct naming (we have plenty of .ini files
 > for Neutron agents). Now, the question is whether we want to adopt
 > to those practices, or force everyone to rename their files.
 > 
 > I don't insist on the change. If you think it's not worth it, folks
 > always have a workaround of creating symlinks with .conf
 > extensions. (Some RDO packages for networking-* actually do just
 > that.)

Yeah, I don't feel particularly strongly one way or the other. My main concern is thinking through the implications of the change. It wouldn't be a problem if there is an INI file with unused values. It wouldn't be an issue if there is an INI with used values. Might there be a problem if the INI file is also symlinked to a .conf file? Maybe if you add some more test cases for the variations we think exist in real systems, we can get a sense for whether the change is likely to be dangerous."}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-04-06 13:03:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I'm not blocking this, need others' input"}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-04-26 23:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Would need some tests.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-05 21:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I don't have time to complete it. Feel free to take over."}]

[{'created': '2017-03-17 18:24:25.000000000', 'message': "Read .ini files when --config-dir used

Some projects extensively use .ini extensions for their config files
(for example, neutron and lots of its plugins). While you may argue that
they should not have done that in the first place, we cannot just rename
their files because that would cause havoc on upgrade.

I think it makes sense for oslo.config, a library that read
INI-formatted files to read .ini files, and that's exactly what the
patch does.

Change-Id: I17f4615beb2c1ea5026d9070a063c75ac273cef2
Closes-Bug: #1673852
"}]
commit_message:
Read .ini files when --config-dir used

Some projects extensively use .ini extensions for their config files
(for example, neutron and lots of its plugins). While you may argue that
they should not have done that in the first place, we cannot just rename
their files because that would cause havoc on upgrade.

I think it makes sense for oslo.config, a library that read
INI-formatted files to read .ini files, and that's exactly what the
patch does.

Change-Id: I17f4615beb2c1ea5026d9070a063c75ac273cef2
Closes-Bug: #1673852

commit_message:
Kill all fullstack processes with SIGTERM

Some processes were still killed with SIGKILL. SIGTERM provides a chance
to services to gracefully shut down.

Change-Id: I0971c4fcd54b8ff7dc3a45f14e8120f5773623a1
Closes-Bug: #1487548

commit_message:
Make fernet utils and config more generic

This change renames the fernet_utils into token_utils in order
to be reused by other non-persisted token formats that may
get added in the future.

Also added config options under the "token" section to reference
the same values under the fernet_tokens section in order to move
to a more generic named setting.

This change also moves the fernet doctor checks into a more
generic token category.

Change-Id: Iaef7b6087a73c70264ea9addbc77f1503ad79322

subject: Handle float('inf') in tenant_quota_usages properly
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-01-05 20:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 18:54:44.000000000', 'message': "Handle float('inf') in tenant_quota_usages properly

tenant_absolute_limits API wrapper converts -1 (unlimited)
to float('inf'), but tenant_quota_usages() cannot handle this
properly. This is a regression during the quota refactoring work.
This commit changes QuotaUsage.add_quota() to accept float('inf')
as one of unlimited quota value.

Closes-Bug: #1741493
Part of blueprint make-quotas-great-again
Change-Id: Ic6ed00761381d52ee04a15a43ee4fe2a30b9a106
"}]
commit_message:
Handle float('inf') in tenant_quota_usages properly

tenant_absolute_limits API wrapper converts -1 (unlimited)
to float('inf'), but tenant_quota_usages() cannot handle this
properly. This is a regression during the quota refactoring work.
This commit changes QuotaUsage.add_quota() to accept float('inf')
as one of unlimited quota value.

Closes-Bug: #1741493
Part of blueprint make-quotas-great-again
Change-Id: Ic6ed00761381d52ee04a15a43ee4fe2a30b9a106

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iabc08e643c5978b486d966b824b70ac92b45b4cc
(cherry picked from commit 69ec55d6f82a95d7b4951b19a17e2a31a72c3e7a)
(cherry picked from commit fd1517dbf8bb845fdb416a773c4adafbcd9c00bc)

The documentation jobs now look for requirements in
doc/requirements.txt and do not use tox for release notes. Move the
dependency list from setup.cfg to the new file and update tox.ini so
the developer experience is consistent with what the CI system does.

Changes in cherry-pick due to different versions used in ocata.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ffdb1f0ba05555686840065a4cae36b93de86b5)
(cherry picked from commit 07364d43a8014acd5185375eaf3f61bf533c7add)
'}]
commit_message:
move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt

The documentation jobs now look for requirements in
doc/requirements.txt and do not use tox for release notes. Move the
dependency list from setup.cfg to the new file and update tox.ini so
the developer experience is consistent with what the CI system does.

Changes in cherry-pick due to different versions used in ocata.

Change-Id: I739c9eba21d1b9a680d6b0e9cc6a4cbaca56e543
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ffdb1f0ba05555686840065a4cae36b93de86b5)
(cherry picked from commit 07364d43a8014acd5185375eaf3f61bf533c7add)

commit_message:
Deploy with ansible inside orchestration container

  * Add deploy playbook
  * Add Dockerfile
  * Also uses regular filenames with underscores as key in configmaps
    since kubectl creates them from file this way

Change-Id: I8c7ceddacc7be1262f6ad565003ff14bb4d60af0

commit_message:
Add method to escape ipv6 ip addresses

IPv6 addresses are commonly enclosed in square brackets
in resource identifiers to allow them to be distinguished
from port numbers.

I've come accross the need of this in multiple places
zaqar https://review.openstack.org/#/c/495279
tripleo https://review.openstack.org/#/c/494440
ironic https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411809
ironic-python-agent https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411817

Change-Id: Icdcf681c1d71a09b88b029f80d13cd5015dacd56

messages:
[{'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2017-08-02 09:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2017-08-02 10:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I am using UEFI for AArch64 VMs for years. When Mitaka got support for it I was happy. Then a need to set hw_firmware_type=uefi for each image where there was no other sane way of booting made me sad.

Kernel+initrd combo is something I consider last hope call but tested it on AArch64 as well on VM with UEFI enabled and it booted just fine directly to kernel.

It is not x86-64 where you have a choice: BIOS or UEFI. We have only UEFI. So make it default.


With some language changes to commit message it can go.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-02 11:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Use UEFI as the default boot for AArch64

There are two ways of booting VM on AArch64 architecture:

1. UEFI
2. kernel+initrd

No one sane goes for 2nd option so hw_firmware_type=uefi has to be set
for every image. Otherwise they simply hang. So let's set is as default
if no other value for hw_firmware_type is set.

If someone will implement own way then they can set hw_firmware_type to
own value and add support to Nova.

Closes-Bug: #1740824

Co-authored-by: Kevin Zhao <Kevin.Zhao@arm.com>
Change-Id: I70ad5ecb420b7d469854e8743e38ba27fd204747

[{'created': '2018-01-03 17:39:08.000000000', 'message': "Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to not having
3e37c2e10e1701c4cc782f31b9e5917011123261 nor
d5244f2fae1e0b0c6e80c1e3b2f1b48fd2c8d1d9 in Pike.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856
(cherry picked from commit 1706e3989157f912bce99beb99c75216a064eb2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to not having
3e37c2e10e1701c4cc782f31b9e5917011123261 nor
d5244f2fae1e0b0c6e80c1e3b2f1b48fd2c8d1d9 in Pike.

commit_message:
Use same instance of iptables_manager in L2 agent and extensions

This commit adds common_agent_extension class which is agent API
for L2 extension drivers used e.g. by Linuxbridge agent.
This is necessary to be able to use instance of iptables_manager
used in firewall driver also in L2 extension drivers (like qos).

This patch refactors little bit iptables_manager code to make possible
to initialize e.g. mangle or nat table on demand, even if iptables
is created as "state_less"

Change-Id: I3b66e49b7f176124e8aea3eb96d0d465f1ab1ea0
Closes-Bug: #1736674

commit_message:
Use secure random function for AES encryption

Switched from using a statistical PRNG, random.randint(), to using a
cryptographically secure function random.SystemRandom().choice() as is
suggested by the Python documentation for the random module.

Change-Id: Ie3ebf65f7c87621c98819c21622278347e42a5a5
Closes-Bug: #1649634

[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-10-17 14:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2017-10-18 14:06:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Seemingly related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512408/

The 'revoke-sudo' role is included through unittests: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/tree/playbooks/unittests/pre.yaml#n7

It sounds like revoke-sudo should just be explicit rather than inherited from unittests ?
It looks like we're duplicating a lot of code just to toggle sudo on and off."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-04 18:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Please mention tox-functional-with-sudo in commit message as well'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 06:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-05 09:35:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I could be talking out of my hat here, but is this not something that one could configure by way of an attribute, a la Travis' 'sudo: false' option?"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Jens, see I0c7c508996ad2647db706d4ebf156c5dd96bf9b5 - we fixed this yesterday.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Ah, I missed that dependency, thx.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add openstack-tox-with-sudo test jobs

Some tox jobs need to not have sudo revoked. Make a job that can be used
that runs tox as the other jobs do but does not revoke sudo first.

Also, add a openstack-tox-functional-with-sudo job as needed by os-vif.

Update some job descriptions.

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: Ida9404d2d6d2a4385e92cb40016f1c8bccd7198f
Needed-By: I5b3a6ce0355616084d968c1b01e5629cf0b674bd

[{'account_id': 13996, 'date': '2017-11-18 02:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-11-18 02:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/521219/1/ : FAILURE in 16s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-11-20 07:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Clean backport. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-13 14:48:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is harmless but it doesn't really fix a bug in stable/pike. I think the change in queens was made so that we'd stop using deprecated things so we don't break, but removal of that isn't going to break stable/pike at this point because upper-constraints in stable/pike is more or less capped to the point that brick in pike can't remove deprecated things."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-18 02:53:45.000000000', 'message': 'Update libvirt volume drivers to use os-brick constants

Most drivers had hard coded protocol strings, and one driver was using
a constant from os-brick that has been deprecated for removal for quite
some time.

This updates all volume drivers to use the current available constants
from os-brick.

Change-Id: I8682804d2299db793c1e4397a07ff67608a8bda6
Closes-bug: #1721993
(cherry picked from commit 3daeb9681efee5719e4c77db1389c48009f97d05)
'}]
commit_message:
Update libvirt volume drivers to use os-brick constants

Most drivers had hard coded protocol strings, and one driver was using
a constant from os-brick that has been deprecated for removal for quite
some time.

This updates all volume drivers to use the current available constants
from os-brick.

Change-Id: I8682804d2299db793c1e4397a07ff67608a8bda6
Closes-bug: #1721993
(cherry picked from commit 3daeb9681efee5719e4c77db1389c48009f97d05)

commit_message:
vitrage: run missing db-sync and add persistor

- Enable messagingv2 on cinder, aodh, heat, neutron and vitrage.
- Allow to configure notification_topics
- Include persistor, db-sync classes
- Enable Vitrage testing on centos7

Depends-On: I2fadae52aa59e3ee0fe74ddd3973a3e0863adca1
Change-Id: I4bdeb0e000d4903a1543434718b3317e552398e2

commit_message:
Enable external openvswitch

Many people needs to have kolla interfaces using vlan configured on OVS for
performance. With our current architecture it's impossible to do this.
We need to allow OVS to be pre-configured manually if someone would like
to use something like that.

Change-Id: I488c7d7fa045424592f82c3ee4e8b3c3a2edaa70

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type config option

Prior to their removal from the tempest repository, the heat tests
supported an endpoint_type option[1] to configure which endpoint
interface to use in its requests to the Orchestration service and other
OpenStack services. This patch adds back this support so that users can
configure the heat tests to run against non-public interfaces.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/config.py?h=17.2.0#n943

Change-Id: Id86f90e428136198b4244f12da5eb53f673fd788

commit_message:
Use tempest-plugin-jobs template for cinder-tempest-plugin

* Cinder tempest plugin contains tempest integration tests not
  unit tests, so it is unfeasible to run unit tests and so we
  have created a template in order to run common set of jobs
  for all tempest plugins, let's consume it.
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531307/ adds the template
  for the same.

Change-Id: Idfcce6674dc9999b8d3e6da0a6ae3d5c2d6e8c0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 10:22:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 10:25:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq-ready check for single node HA deployments

The current rabbitmq-ready exec waits for rabbitmq to become clustered
before it allows user creation. Unfortunately this doesn't work when
the deployment contains a single node, because rabbit doesn't trigger
the clustering mode at all.

Set the exec test according to the number of rabbit nodes, in order
to check for cluster state only when necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1741345

Change-Id: I24e5e344b7f657ce5d42a7c7c45be7b5ed5e6445
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2017-12-20 17:54:21.000000000', 'message': "Workaround missing RequestSpec.project_id when moving an instance

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances used an admin context which has an empty project_id,
so when scheduling (moving) one of these, if we try to PUT /allocations
in placement using the FilterScheduler we'll fail because the project_id
is None.

This works around that by putting the instance.project_id on the request
spec before calling the scheduler to pick a node and claim resources
against it.

A later change will need to add some sort of online data migration
routine so that we properly update and persist the fix for these
older records.

685c16041c7e84fb0861b9b1833fc6c3cc372d05 not
being in Pike.

commit_message:
Workaround missing RequestSpec.project_id when moving an instance

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances used an admin context which has an empty project_id,
so when scheduling (moving) one of these, if we try to PUT /allocations
in placement using the FilterScheduler we'll fail because the project_id
is None.

This works around that by putting the instance.project_id on the request
spec before calling the scheduler to pick a node and claim resources
against it.

A later change will need to add some sort of online data migration
routine so that we properly update and persist the fix for these
older records.

Conflicts:
      nova/conductor/manager.py
      nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py
      nova/conductor/tasks/migrate.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to
ca716ce4dd512e864886998a24e111e7d6e05848 and
685c16041c7e84fb0861b9b1833fc6c3cc372d05 not
being in Pike.

Change-Id: I34b1d99a9d0d2aca80f094a79ec1656abaf762dc
Partial-Bug: #1739318
(cherry picked from commit f9a06c42535ef7ebba92c793afd947073352f850)

[{'created': '2017-12-20 17:54:21.000000000', 'message': "Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old

commit_message:
Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances is using an admin context, which doesn't have a project_id
set, which means the request spec that gets created doesn't have
a project_id set, which matters when the FilterScheduler tries to
claim resources (create allocations in Placement) using said
request spec's project_id (PUT /allocations requires a non-null
project_id).

This fixes the online data migration by creating the request spec
using the instance's project_id rather than that from the context.

Change-Id: I214a44f0eee7d90be5cd89f32f6e0017b19a3fd6
Partial-Bug: #1739318
(cherry picked from commit a148e638dd5eaaa6f9c8749782a625c6523b6b6a)

commit_message:
Switch to pep8 jobs for manila-specs

With the move to zuulv3, the openstack-tox-py* job
definitions ignore doc only changes, so we have dropped
triggering doc checks from the py27,py35 targets and
are instead running doc8 against the spec directory from
the pep8 target.

Switch the configure check and gate jobs to run pep8
so that we can catch and prevent formatting errors in
new specs.

Change-Id: Ie01d83ab3c022057281b080f6822d644a0cf57e9
Depends-On: I82c8dbec713fc5575fd03c0ae290bf190bbdf8ca

commit_message:
Added openstack-tempest-plugins job template

* Since due to tempest plugin goals, we have more than 20 plugins
  and each of them are using same type of jobs. So it is better to
  unify them and use it.

Change-Id: I2f78a61b09ab8d413b305b62416a4056601a61cc

commit_message:
cleanup data collection admin guide

- remove list of notifications used for meters, it's not accurate
and is arguably of no value to an administrator even if it's
accurate. just list where the endpoints are and how to configure.
- remove comments about database connection, this means nothing
- remove libvirt comment, listing all services polled as these are
stated elsewhere and are just repeated.

Change-Id: If67ecf7e507da70abae3734618358c2458f49037
(cherry picked from commit d5a89cd997b25b5aab286377a8f058f38c36c736)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 23:47:39.000000000', 'message': 'Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING

Token expiration is normal, however the client logs fill up with these
ominous WARNING messages:

WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Authorization failed for token
WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Identity response: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: 24ffb14540c74a7c964f9627fe2af8fb", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}

It seems more useful to log normal events at a level less than WARNING,
this would reduce the log size but more importantly it will help
elminate the concerns raised when logs are filled with WARNING messages
that are otherwise benign.

Change-Id: I54ad6b5530ee81616bd4a44f8295985f5d84c2ee
Closes-Bug: #1738300
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-18 16:30:45.000000000', 'message': 'Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING

Token expiration is normal, however the client logs fill up with these
ominous WARNING messages:

WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Authorization failed for token
WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Identity response: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: 24ffb14540c74a7c964f9627fe2af8fb", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}

It seems more useful to log normal events at a level less than WARNING,
this would reduce the log size but more importantly it will help
elminate the concerns raised when logs are filled with WARNING messages
that are otherwise benign.

Change-Id: I54ad6b5530ee81616bd4a44f8295985f5d84c2ee
Closes-Bug: #1738300
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING

Token expiration is normal, however the client logs fill up with these
ominous WARNING messages:

WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Authorization failed for token
WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Identity response: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: 24ffb14540c74a7c964f9627fe2af8fb", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}

It seems more useful to log normal events at a level less than WARNING,
this would reduce the log size but more importantly it will help
elminate the concerns raised when logs are filled with WARNING messages
that are otherwise benign.

Change-Id: I54ad6b5530ee81616bd4a44f8295985f5d84c2ee
Closes-Bug: #1738300
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Extract netmiko device configuration save

The configuration save operation of netmiko devices is extracted into a
separate function. This allows devices to implement the function as
required, or to use the base class's implementation.

Change-Id: I135ccb842a1120b099afe1107da7b549bad943ef
Related-Bug: #1740587

commit_message:
Openstack metrics exporter for prometheus

This exporter provides a means for Prometheus to gather openstack
service metrics related to overlying openstack-helm deployments
Change-Id: I5f1789c62b4547add0c67edb51540f712bf43da8

commit_message:
Pass network_id to device's del_network method

This allows devices which reference VLANs by name and not ID
(such as Juniper Junos devices) to delete networks by name, which
is their neutron ID.

Change-Id: If1257fad47d05016dc59a8cfc60f5d2d22be420c
Related-Bug: #1740587

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 22:56:32.000000000', 'message': "add bluestore-specific config options

Adds bluestore-specific options related to the metadata-only journal.

the 'experimental' option is no longer needed
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/luminous/src/common/legacy_config_opts.h#L79

It also has been dropped from example configs
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/fdd81ccf758b9fba25967094ef7a9b4d35f57a10

The options allow a user to control:

1. path to a bluestore wal (block special file or regular file)
2. path to a bluestore db (block special file or regular file)
3. size of both

Their configuration works similarly to the FileStore journal. If paths
are not specified both WAL and DB will be collocated on the same block
device as data.

Other options can be configured via an existing config-flags option if needed.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/bluestore-config-ref/

Change-Id: Ia85092230d4dcb0435354deb276012f923547393
Depends-On: I483ee9dae4ce69c71ae06359d0fb96aaa1c56cbc

commit_message:
add bluestore-specific config options

Adds bluestore-specific options related to the metadata-only journal.

The options allow a user to control:

1. path to a bluestore wal (block special file or regular file)
2. path to a bluestore db (block special file or regular file)
3. size of both

Their configuration works similarly to the FileStore journal. If paths
are not specified both WAL and DB will be collocated on the same block
device as data.

Other options can be configured via an existing config-flags option if needed.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/bluestore-config-ref/

Closes-Bug: #1710474
Change-Id: Ia85092230d4dcb0435354deb276012f923547393
Depends-On: I483ee9dae4ce69c71ae06359d0fb96aaa1c56cbc
Depends-On: Idbbb69acec92b2f2efca80691ca73a2030bcf633

commit_message:
Ingress: Allow annotations to be dyanmicly driven

This PS allows the ingress rules to be dynamicly driven from the
values.yaml, permitting the ingress cotnroller to ba changed and
custom rules to be applied: eg whitelisting of clients.

Change-Id: Ica6b4692ff9b6b77d1efe6bae212a1227e56ca66

[{'created': '2017-11-16 23:54:14.000000000', 'message': "Use correct raw string format

You're not supposed to just randomly put backslashes in front of other
characters that don't need escaping unless it's a raw string. This is
deprecated in Python 3.6.

Change-Id: I7a69ba6dd10412bb065f2b6ba405840d0a98663a
"}]
commit_message:
Use correct raw string format

You're not supposed to just randomly put backslashes in front of other
characters that don't need escaping unless it's a raw string. This is
deprecated in Python 3.6.

Change-Id: I7a69ba6dd10412bb065f2b6ba405840d0a98663a

commit_message:
WIP Remove keystoneclient.session usage

This change removes all usage of keystoneclient.session
which has been long deprecated, and replaces it with
keystoneauth1.session.

Change-Id: I3cf345e3396a098b678364bfa3985f9eb3c36f83

commit_message:
Libvirt: move configuration to be generated directly from values

This PS moves the configuration files used by libvirt to be
generated directly from the values, rather than being templated.

Change-Id: I8ab2783c9d1d5d815cc02eccafa21058ff3acead

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 00:49:47.000000000', 'message': 'Perserve env variables

This patch set adds in -E flag for ``sudo pip install`` so
any environment variable is preserved for the install.  This allows
for some proxy-related variables such as ``http_proxy`` to pass
through for pip.

Change-Id: I89881d811b53b27e2663a40c1c96fcf18e614b00
'}]
commit_message:
Perserve env variables

This patch set adds in -E flag for ``sudo pip install`` so
any environment variable is preserved for the install.  This allows
for some proxy-related variables such as ``http_proxy`` to pass
through for pip.

Change-Id: I89881d811b53b27e2663a40c1c96fcf18e614b00

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 16:37:59.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #1705533(from launchpad.net) fix

Bug was in error message being displayed.

**Previously:

manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0

ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:

manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0

Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
ERROR: DefaultShareTypeNotFound: Default share type not found.
'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 06:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying the
share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default share
type which is not existant. The error message which should be displayed
is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is to change the
parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing it from
ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 07:05:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying the
share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default share
type which is not existant. The error message which should be displayed
is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is to change the
parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing it from
ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0
ERROR: DefaultShareTypeNotFound: Default share type not found.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 13:58:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message in the manage API.

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying the
share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default share
type which is not existant. The error message which should be displayed
is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is to change the
parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing it from
ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool nfs 127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e49266f0
ERROR: DefaultShareTypeNotFound: Default share type not found.
