commit_message:
Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying
the share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default
sharetype which is not existant. The error message which should be
displayed is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is
to change the parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing
it from ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Default share type not found.

Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 23:17:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add env vars to set the RAM for VMS in the mnaio

The MNAIO serves as a good way to play with a production like OSA
environment on minimal hardware. While this is a good way to test it
does leave some options hard to address and change when trying to build
in an automated way. This change makes it possible for a deployer to set
an environmental variable to change the ram allocation of all default vm
types which should help folks build a more capable and customizable test
cloud.

Change-Id: Idc2cff091701ecda80165a98fffa1db222600d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add env vars to set the RAM for VMS in the mnaio

The MNAIO serves as a good way to play with a production like OSA
environment on minimal hardware. While this is a good way to test it
does leave some options hard to address and change when trying to build
in an automated way. This change makes it possible for a deployer to set
an environmental variable to change the ram allocation of all default vm
types which should help folks build a more capable and customizable test
cloud.

Change-Id: Idc2cff091701ecda80165a98fffa1db222600d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Log by default all output of quickstart.sh

Log everything from quickstart.sh by default into _quickstart.log
for future investigations, bug reports, etc.
Add force color in case of interactive shell, because it doesn't
color output in subshell by default.

Change-Id: I1780785fee32d2a5c8eca77cf0becea7a5342220

commit_message:
Force IPSEC connection initiation between hosts

This prevents other services from experiencing timeouts due to the
tunnels being lazily initiated.

Change-Id: Ic21f38938e21472c42d6cf70787124f9468d46ea

supporting consistent data presentation under Python 3 where
dict key iteration is non-deterministic.

commit_message:
Pass data to hacluster charm using JSON

Encode dicts passed to hacluster charm using JSON serialization,
supporting consistent data presentation under Python 3 where
dict key iteration is non-deterministic.

This is supported by prefixing json based data items with 'json_'
and encoding with keys sorted.

The charm will also clear any unprefixed based data items for
upgrades.

Change-Id: I21c6acff4a4a22cbcc5e6ea4e78394ce076e79d9
Closes-Bug: 1741304
Depends-On: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6

commit_message:
Adds SR-IOV support

In order to use SR-IOV on a compute node, the feature has
to be enabled and supported by the OS and the NICs.

The nova-compute service will report the SR-IOV VFs as
PCI devices. SR-IOV is requested by creating a neutron port with
the binding:vnic_type direct.

The Hyper-V Mechanism Driver already supports ports with vnic_type direct,
so no changes are necessary to it.

An SR-IOV neutron port will contain the pci_slot in the port's profile.
When can use that information in order to determine whether SR-IOV has to
be enabled or not.

Depends-On: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

Implements: blueprint networking-hyperv-sriov

Change-Id: I131d65e45c59eec577bb8d076f674146e37de8e3

commit_message:
use format{v4,v6} options for Newton+

format option was removed in Pike but added in Newton - we need an
appropriate template for that while preserving Mitaka compatibility
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/pike.html#critical-issues

Change-Id: Ib5cb4bd79aba6ca37b21b8f0942bb09f9341d328
Closes-Bug: #1733079

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 bindep fallback tests

For project-config itself, use native Zuul v3 tests for testing that we
can install the bindep list for the used distributions.

Note that the new job does not run if the local bindep.txt file or
other-requirements.txt is changed since those files are irreleant for
this test. This test only tests jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt.

Since project-config is trusted, we cannot directly test that the jobs
work. Therefore add them as experimental - and then test that they work.
A followup change will then use these jobs by default.

Change-Id: Ia95b73aa955a07840ce9b66ba36a6da821e1d34c

commit_message:
drop notifications_designate, add missing section

A separate topic has been used for nova, neutron -> designate. Let's use
a single one instead.

Closes-Bug: #1710831

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 20:53:18.000000000', 'message': "Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112

commit_message:
Switch Glance-related tests (dashboards.project.images) to mock

Some duplicated test scenarios were deleted. This patch also doesn't
change Selenium tests because it's out of scope of unit tests.

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test module:
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py

Change-Id: I951c2e5ee1c133faa2106e1e1fdba5c72d6f63b7
Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

commit_message:
Support use of json for relation data

In order to provide consistent presentation of relation data
in Python 3 based charms, support passing of data using JSON
format which ensures that data on relations won't continually
change due to non-deterministic dictionary iteration in py3.

Change-Id: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6
Closes-Bug: 1741304

commit_message:
Remove bundled intree trove tempest plugin

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527122/ moves the intree
  tempest plugin to a new repo trove-tempest-plugin. Let'use
  it for the same.

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530024/ consumes new trove
  tempest plugin in python-troveclient

Change-Id: I59aafa0ec978033ba4add2bc2a2144d177afb9ac

commit_message:
Allow ports filtering with device_id

Right now, if a neutron port is owned by a container powered by
Kuryr, there is no way to list and filter those ports because
OSC assumed a neutron port is owned by either a server or router.
This patch adds support for that by introducing an option '--device-id'
to the 'port list' command.

Change-Id: Ib1fd27e8d843a99fb02ccabd8a12a24ac27cec9c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22818, 'name': 'Manoj Kumar', 'email': 'manoj@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'manojnkumar'}]

[{'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-07-29 10:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-07-29 10:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-07-29 10:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Marked WF-1 till we hit the point where master->Queens'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-29 11:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/488947/1/check/gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial/fecdc00/ : SUCCESS in 2m 45s
- gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/488947/1/check/gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/5ecb1b5/ : FAILURE in 1m 47s
- gate-governance-tox-validate-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/488947/1/check/gate-governance-tox-validate-ubuntu-xenial/f10522d/ : SUCCESS in 13m 02s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-07-29 11:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-07-29 11:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

till we hit the point where master->Queens'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-29 11:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/488947/2/check/gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial/1ae6c27/ : SUCCESS in 2m 06s
- gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/47/488947/2/check/gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/8e9f28d//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 48s
- gate-governance-tox-validate-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/488947/2/check/gate-governance-tox-validate-ubuntu-xenial/816e1a7/ : SUCCESS in 13m 22s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-08-01 08:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Reading this report it feels like the low point is behind us for Trove, and we should prepare people to get excited for the next phase, rather than sending signals that the project is in limbo.

During my recent Asian tour I met several large users who said that Trove was the next project they intended to deploy: I feel like we should work on recruiting those for further development, rather than send out a message that Trove is in uncertain waters for an indefinite period of time. I just fear that at this point setting the tag would be a counter-productive message...

Also see syntax issue inline.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-08-04 19:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I will wait for other comments on the merits of the proposal before responding.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-08-11 12:23:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

with the creation of the changes that will branch trove for pike, I'm removing the WF=-1 on this."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-08-15 10:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-08-17 15:53:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

+1 ttx's point.

If its on the up, lets not add this in right now, as the work to rebuild the effort around the project seems on the way already?

But still happy to consider this, if someone thinks this is helpful still, but sounds like its just not the case anymore?"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2017-09-06 13:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

While I understand the reasoning behind ttx's comment, I feel like it would be better to let this patch in and be clear about the current status.

The maintenance-mode tag sets clear expectations about the status of the project and what the consumers of it can expect from the team. For instance, I believe the following point from the maintenance-mode tag plays in favor for the Trove team as it would allow the team to focus on getting up to speed:

  * the project team does not guarantee the implementation and delivery of new features and functionality

I'm worried - probably as John and ttx - about how outsiders would interpret the tag. The Trove team, the TC and the rest of the community will have to message the actual status of the project properly.

One final note, it may be that applying this tag would give similar results as adding the project to the top-5 list."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-09-13 19:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-09-13 19:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-09-13 19:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

There are several areas where I believe we can continue to make progress:

a) Currency of OS and DB levels
b) Simplify creation of images for Trove
c) Introduce a third party gate so that the tests have fewer false failures
d) Lay the foundation so that some of the issues highlighted at the PTG can be addressed in a more incremental fashion

etc.

If we are able to accomplish the above over the next cycle or two, I would suspect that the maintenance tag would not be needed. So I would prefer deferring this tag.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-09-24 15:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> There are several areas where I believe we can continue to make
 > progress:
 > 
 > a) Currency of OS and DB levels
 > b) Simplify creation of images for Trove
 > c) Introduce a third party gate so that the tests have fewer false
 > failures
 > d) Lay the foundation so that some of the issues highlighted at the
 > PTG can be addressed in a more incremental fashion
 > 
 > etc.
 > 
 > If we are able to accomplish the above over the next cycle or two,
 > I would suspect that the maintenance tag would not be needed. So I
 > would prefer deferring this tag.

The stated intent of the flag is to reflect the current state of the project, and your statements are consistent with the objective of improving the project over time, and removing the tag.

Once you are able to demonstrate the things which you assert you intend to, then the tag can be removed.

Not adding the tag at this point is doing a dis-service to the people who wish to use the project and are surprised to find that it is not actively being maintained (fact).'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-09-26 20:28:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > There are several areas where I believe we can continue to make

 > >
 > > a) Currency of OS and DB levels

 > The stated intent of the flag is to reflect the current state of
 > the project, and your statements are consistent with the objective
 > of improving the project over time, and removing the tag.
 > 
 > Once you are able to demonstrate the things which you assert you
 > intend to, then the tag can be removed.
 > 
 > Not adding the tag at this point is doing a dis-service to the
 > people who wish to use the project and are surprised to find that
 > it is not actively being maintained (fact).

If there is a team actively working on the project in those areas, it seems like the tag is not needed. Given the large hand-off in management that has just happened, I think it's reasonable to hold off a little while and let the new folks come up to speed before making a decision about this tag. Some people are only just returning to work after PTO after the PTG, after all."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-09-27 01:16:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

per discussion at the TC office hours today (Wednesday 9/27 0100UTC) I'm marking this as WF-1"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-09-27 01:19:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-29 10:47:07.000000000', 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

Change-Id: I7fd30908454d9a01b15fd2d661a7b6165778279d

victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group

[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

'}, {'created': '2017-09-14 16:49:06.000000000', 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

commit_message:
Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

Rename option '--rm' to '--auto-remove'

Also, the name style is more consistent with other options (prefer
full name to acronym).

commit_message:
Update amulet tests for new s3/ec2/nova username

Keystone now orders the elements of the username when constructing
a username for multiple services. Update amulet to expect the
new username (only actually affects icehouse).

Change-Id: I6ac49b0a2782df2ebc8f3d1fe299dec3cc078d7c

commit_message:
drop driver and topic settings in designate ctx

A similar change will land in designate to drop this extra topic as
well.

Also, driver and topic overrides in a service-specific context are not a
good idea.

Change-Id: I804a34fb044090010ecfd2560594cc1f55e9bd21
Closes-Bug: #1710831
Closes-Bug: #1738100
(cherry picked from commit b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 20:38:42.000000000', 'message': "Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d
"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 01:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d
"}]
commit_message:
Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for identity APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I4c9428f916fd28ee6df701aee26c5e2c516c4913

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for catalog APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I86e3e360b01b3ce27414c13da3d94e22076ee93c

LGTM thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-01-03 02:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Just some nits'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-03 19:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't think you should repurpose update_objects for your needs. If you need to fetch objects, you may as well just do get_objects / update / return in the single place where you need it."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I don't think you should repurpose update_objects for your needs.
 > If you need to fetch objects, you may as well just do get_objects /
 > update / return in the single place where you need it.

update_objects() (plural) will continue to do what it always did. A new method update_object() (singular) is being introduced in this patch. The singular method yes, it will fetch and return the updated object from the database (re: cls._load_object() after it's being updated).

The reason why I need this is because I'm tracking revision numbers on the updates in networking-ovn and calling update_floatingip_status() will bump the revision number of the fip.

If I invoke update_floatingip_status() and then do get_floatingip() there's a chance that another update happened in between this both calls. So it's not ideal.

Also, all update_*() methods that I can point out right now does return the updated version of the resource it just updated, e.g [0][1]

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/bfd55d86fbedb7d5c04a78b3a109abf4903c5aba/neutron/db/l3_db.py#L1414-L1417

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/bfd55d86fbedb7d5c04a78b3a109abf4903c5aba/neutron/db/l3_db.py#L1863-L1867"}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-04 17:08:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-01-04 17:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks @Ihar for taking another look at this'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27507, 'date': '2018-01-05 00:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}]

[{'created': '2017-12-15 16:04:06.000000000', 'message': "FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8
"}, {'created': '2017-12-15 22:15:48.000000000', 'message': "FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8
"}]
commit_message:
FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8

commit_message:
Use ipv6 network templates from tripleo-heat-templates

Update quickstart ovb-ha (ipv6) jobs to use the network templates and
environments from tripleo-heat-templates instead of tripleo-ci. This
allows for having per-branch differences between the templates.

The net-iso.yaml environment from tripleo-ci is uneeded as it's
parameters are also set in network-environment.yaml, so it's usage is
removed.

Change-Id: I18b3bea25cd02682d3c58d665d234f7938e38856

commit_message:
Add a test case for populate_from_iterable()

There is no unit test of populate_from_iterable function for the
case that the parent is already in provider tree and update it at
the same time we add the child for that parent.

So this patch adds that test case.

Change-Id: If2bcefd74f51d0d0bc32eee54494dcaeea8bcbae

commit_message:
Support policy.yaml file for Aodh

This will copy both of yaml or json policy file
if it exists

Change-Id: Ie5e03e0307d239f1079d2522e353367f7f954e77
Implements: blueprint support-custom-policy-yaml
Co-authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Remove function optimize_db_test_loader in test_base.py

optimize_db_test_loader is replaced by optimize_package_test_loader
in test_fixtures.py.So this function is deprecated for removal.

Change-Id: I12cdf846f1e23d74ae8a87bea33fbc8477974bfc
Closes-Bug:#1715572

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-30 03:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73

security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73

commit_message:
Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73

commit_message:
Add search_opts in func list of ManagerWithFind type classes

In patch I96339778fa69c379863078250d5dfa7172f2c1b2, it called
self.list with search_opts, but some subclasses of ManagerWithFind
do not have search_opts in function list, this make some list
functions and show by name functions fail and throw 'unexpected
keyword argument search_opts' error. This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ic4b65c0e5900a0e3e19155d5d9d42d5063c3137d
Closes-Bug: #1738917
Closes-Bug: #1738918

commit_message:
WIP: MairaDB: take ownership of entrypoint script

It has been observed that the MariaDB entrypoint script does
not always init the container in time, and also returns occasional
false +ves for having performed the init. See:
 * https://github.com/docker-library/mariadb/blob/master/docker-entrypoint.sh#L100-L106

Change-Id: I2b5aaa6a733d566536068b3bacad5a9f017f45e6

commit_message:
Add Grafana chart to OSH infra

Moves the grafana chart to OSH infra along with basic rbac rules
that may be tightened with future work.

Change-Id: Ie14627530a73d4b7b01eb93ca5f7174d99d9caec

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 12:39:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993
(cherry picked from commit 17e8b29067e93dbe5f13d0d18e62b06fcd148d3f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993
(cherry picked from commit 17e8b29067e93dbe5f13d0d18e62b06fcd148d3f)

[{'created': '2017-11-01 16:58:57.000000000', 'message': '[DO NOT MERGE]: PoC lock-free database consistency

Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47
'}, {'created': '2017-11-02 11:55:45.000000000', 'message': "Check for correctness when updating networks

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

Updates with a lower revision number will be skipped ensuring that we
don't overwrite a newer object with an old one if updates are out of order
(due to the postcommit() design).

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47
"}, {'created': '2017-11-06 11:14:20.000000000', 'message': 'Check for correctness when updating networks

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47

commit_message:
Check for correctness when updating networks

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47

commit_message:
Add PTL Election Dates to Schedule

This patch adds a new item to the schedule: email
deadline. It then adds that item, along with ptl nominatons
and ptl elections to the official schedule.

Change-Id: I433c4c51564ec0cd95302a1a14071c23a2bceba5

commit_message:
Fix exception when querying for non-existing items

An IndexError exception is raised when trying to get non-existing and
unique item resources via Neutron network driver.

Even though the exception is caught and raises a base.NetworkException
exception, it should raise an exception from
neutron_client_exceptions.NotFound instead.

Story: 2001424
Task: 6130

Change-Id: I0e99e846bb58b88d98598f2f2b52c7c1f8ea0967

commit_message:
Improve user error messages for duplicate objects

The error handling for duplicate records was not great, specifically
health monitors would return a 500 or a 409 with a bad error message.
This patch improves the errors the user gets back when creating a
duplicate entity.

Co-Authored-By: Jacky Hu <hudayou@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: I03ec527b42d67427541121e59e4433699e04aab8

commit_message:
Modify node name from oldnode to newnode in basics doc

There is no node named oldnode, we can delete the node named newnode
that joined the cluster in the previous setps.

Change-Id: I2cf5baba0e44bf4b2c15c6ea404b88c0e079a419
Signed-off-by: blkart <blkart.org@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Handle InvalidScope exception from oslo.policy

oslo.policy has the ability to check the scope of the request
against the scope of the operation and it will throw an InvalidScope
exception if they don't match. If we catch this exception, we should
throw a Forbidden instead because the caller doesn't have the
necessary role on the intended scope to perform the action.

Change-Id: I8805db48b2ce82397ce70cdb4d6b6d8178603339

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api directly in assignment

Convert use of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.provider_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> for manager
calls. This is the correct way to reference managers now now that
the dependency injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I8e8431750486fc125e277c90557040c11c5802e9

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for resource APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: Id0305ce4e782dc8e8977dc7f802110148da2c901

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for token APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I853dd2d1fec159316b3101750b87aae9368bac58

subject: Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment
messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-04 23:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-04 23:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nActually we probably don't care about this on Pike. Nova only uses the new attachments API when 3.44 is available which wasn't in Pike, so we wouldn't hit this from the Nova side in Pike."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 23:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)

successfully.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 20:37:52.000000000', 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3.
* Doing the remaining storage/incoming upgrade of Gnocchi on step4 when
  swift is ready.
* We can do ceilometer-upgrade at step4, without waiting for swift to
  be ready

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

  step4.

  have been run.

  step3 (configuration+database-sync).

  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)
"}]
commit_message:
gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

commit_message:
Gates: Use OpenStack-Helm-Infra log collection playbook in zuul

This PS proposes to mkve to the log collection playbook from
OSH-Infra in zuul checks, to both provide parity and reduce
tech debt.

Depends-On: I016a5e08163eaccf13331db6faa45fab1e9cf4f2

Change-Id: If1a964046ba0a4d97e7419f88a48bf065cd41e83

commit_message:
Testing new barbican - do not merge

This is just to confirm that with the newest barbican
changed, everything still works.  Its built on the
glance image signing test additions, which in turn depend
on the changes to get containers updated.

Depends-On: I711b91b19b9d65260a21b41d6f9e18b9e282138a
Change-Id: If306d3a2554eb1af6c6e606123927de4c942d697

commit_message:
Cinder is missing the v3 API endpoints.

Communication between Cinder and Horizon requires V3 API endpoints.

This is catch up with kolla-ansible who already have this done.

Change-Id: Iba53ee680ca2b4b0c8753e1da16260868874529a

commit_message:
Documentation of the config datasource.

Full automatic documentation of the options for the agent part.
Documentation of the deployment of an agent.
Documentation of the devstack deployment.

Change-Id: If9f7e5b7bc23f28b3c310ee0c8642ed46048fb99
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

commit_message:
Devstack integration for configuration file validation

This last part adds the agent to the devstack deployment, a
basic tempest test of the datasource and gives an example of
its use.

Implementation of a datasource that transcribes the content
of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

The datasource uses a set of agents deployed on the nodes
to access the configuration files.

Change-Id: Ibda41c44e551e6dc8e5895968018c7169c34c9c8
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Valentin Matton <vmatt.openstack@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

commit_message:
Builtins for configuration file validation

This is a set of builtin useful to check that options
are valid.

Implementation of a datasource that transcribes the content
of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

The datasource uses a set of agents deployed on the nodes
to access the configuration files.

Change-Id: Iebf1260a5c5e37c79528646805d1f2d052d15f28
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Valentin Matton <vmatt.openstack@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

subject: Datasource for configuration file validation

commit_message:
Datasource for configuration file validation

This is the datasource itself that communicates with the agent through
the message bus.

Implementation of a datasource that transcribes the content
of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

The datasource uses a set of agents deployed on the nodes
to access the configuration files.

Change-Id: I9919a3595225440cacdbfa9633c0cb5ccd7e31fd
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Valentin Matton <vmatt.openstack@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

I updated the hash function to use the regular uuid function following the discussion on the spec.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-11-09 10:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-29 00:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-29 00:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-11-29 08:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8215, 'date': '2017-12-01 19:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-12-04 06:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-12-04 07:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Hi Pierre, Valentin, Thanks for the patch. Have some minor comments inline. Apart from that
1. Please remove WIP in commit message, if its final patch.
2. If this patch depends-on or needed-by any other proposed patches, please add Depends-On tag or Needed-by tag , would be helpful in review. 
3. Could you please add some documentation, on using this feature, would be really helpful. Looks like agent would be started as separate service here, could you update the same in README on how to start the service and the functionality details.

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

I have removed the WIP but it refered to the fact that it is a partial implementation of the blueprint. Some use Partially Implements: but I am not sure it is fully supported. 
Depends-on is intended for multi project dependencies.
I will add the documentation as a new commit but I have done a few change in this commit to make the generation of the documentation of options for the agent working.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-05 15:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-05 17:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-12-06 04:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

>> I have removed the WIP but it refered to the fact that it is a partial implementation of the blueprint. Some use Partially Implements: but I am not sure it is fully supported. 
Depends-on is intended for multi project dependencies.

Right, sorry my bad . Depends-on shouldnt be used . But Partially-Implements is supported and you can use the same'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I have done some renaming to use congress-agent.conf and [agent] instead of validator_agt.conf and the group [cfg_validator] for the agent configuration to make the naming more consistent (visible in the documentation).

Some devstack tests are failing but the feature is not integrated yet at this point in devstack. Those errors seem transient (sometimes they fail on the p35 version sometimes on the py27). I guess I cannot use recheck command.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-12-12 19:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-04 09:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-04 20:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Agent for configuration file validation

This is the agent part of the blueprint.

Implementation of a datasource that transcribes the content
of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

The datasource uses a set of agents deployed on the nodes
to access the configuration files.

Change-Id: I56750cfd72ad43d8af123d151f70d1d76568a456
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Valentin Matton <vmatt.openstack@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

commit_message:
Support UDP load balancing

Currently, there is not related UDP LB API. We intro a new LVS backend
which will work alongside the existing haproxy for UDP loadbalancing.

Change-Id: I1cd9fb55e171da1b9c1e703896917ec5b7c5d025
Story: 1657091

[{'created': '2017-10-02 07:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add NIC Switchdev feature

Switchdev enables offloading rules from the datapath directly to
the NIC.
Libvirt support quering the NIC for Switchdev capability:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-September/msg00482.html
More information regarding Switchdev can be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/11

Change-Id: I4220e795d744fbf76ce9f2deeceaa6ad3b9494ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add NIC Switchdev feature

Switchdev enables offloading rules from the datapath directly to
the NIC.
Libvirt support quering the NIC for Switchdev capability:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-September/msg00482.html
More information regarding Switchdev can be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/11

Change-Id: I4220e795d744fbf76ce9f2deeceaa6ad3b9494ce

messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-04 17:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-04 18:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 17:57:55.000000000', 'message': "Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a
"}]
commit_message:
Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a

commit_message:
Match on subnet update_networks_matching_iface_port

* Add subnet to interface managed keys when updating nets matching
  interface port
* Add tests to verify that matching on "poor" nets with only
  subnet works.

Change-Id: I3c2a251088fafef78c69aa4a758137907f414a60
Related-Bug: #1696483
Related-Bug: #1702279

During NetScaler driver login, password would be logged at info

message.

Change-Id: I8f5a19a9b51202a1c4bb9852ccdc3271ba479ea6
(cherry picked from commit b8018be8258f1bb1b46db95af4fd33f10eb42a4c)

commit_message:
Fix to prevent password from being displayed in logs.

During NetScaler driver login, password would be logged at info
level.  This changes the code to remove the password from the logged
message.

Change-Id: I8f5a19a9b51202a1c4bb9852ccdc3271ba479ea6
(cherry picked from commit b8018be8258f1bb1b46db95af4fd33f10eb42a4c)

commit_message:
Expose BDM uuid to drivers

BDMs are exposed to drivers via DriverBlockDevice. This will be used
as a disk serial number in a subsequent change to the libvirt driver.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I8609a867039af137bb3d05de55285b10894a507b

subject: DriverBlockDevice: make subclasses inherit _proxy_as_attr

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 13:06:59.000000000', 'message': "DriverBlockDevice: make subclasses inherit _proxy_as_attr

This is a minor tidy-up in current code, as it allows volume_id and
volume_size to be inherited by all subclasses of
DriverVolumeBlockDevice. However, it's primary purpose it to make it
cleaner to add uuid to all DriverBlockDevice subclasses in a subsequent
patch.

Change-Id: Ifabfaacf8752923493a78248593d2727a8ce4803
"}, {'created': '2017-12-05 13:19:25.000000000', 'message': "DriverBlockDevice: make subclasses inherit _proxy_as_attr

This is a minor tidy-up in current code, as it allows volume_id and
volume_size to be inherited by all subclasses of
DriverVolumeBlockDevice. However, it's primary purpose it to make it
cleaner to add uuid to all DriverBlockDevice subclasses in a subsequent

commit_message:
DriverBlockDevice: make subclasses inherit _proxy_as_attr

This is a minor tidy-up in current code, as it allows volume_id and
volume_size to be inherited by all subclasses of
DriverVolumeBlockDevice. However, it's primary purpose it to make it
cleaner to add uuid to all DriverBlockDevice subclasses in a subsequent
patch.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: Ifabfaacf8752923493a78248593d2727a8ce4803

A couple of things:

First, I didn't think we were using these templates anymore, in favor of https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/master/ci/environments/network/multiple-nics

Second, these are generated templates.  Ideally they shouldn't be hand-edited this way.  The generator does support the script style (it calls it v2) so it would be better to just regenerate them with that version so if someone were  to come along and want to make changes in the tool everything is in sync.

But the first point is still the main one.  Maybe the switchover hasn't completely happened yet?"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-04 19:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of If3cc2749c070a9e88a33b8b0643aeef8a97dd181'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 21:15:19.000000000', 'message': 'Convert nic-config templates

The nic-config templates used in tripleo-ci were never updated to use
"group: script" and were still using the deprecated "group:
os-apply-config".

This commit updates the templates. Doing so means they will also work
with the config-download deploy mechanism which only supports the
"group: script" method. This update allows us to move forward with
converting ci jobs that use these templates (such as ovb-ha) to use
config-download.

Change-Id: I23dcb9da36a609bcae57eabd7e072d094df5c884
'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 14:45:35.000000000', 'message': 'Convert nic-config templates

The nic-config templates used in tripleo-ci were never updated to use
"group: script" and were still using the deprecated "group:
os-apply-config".

This commit updates the templates. Doing so means they will also work
with the config-download deploy mechanism which only supports the
"group: script" method. This update allows us to move forward with
converting ci jobs that use these templates (such as ovb-ha) to use
config-download.

Change-Id: I23dcb9da36a609bcae57eabd7e072d094df5c884
'}]
commit_message:
Convert nic-config templates

The nic-config templates used in tripleo-ci were never updated to use
"group: script" and were still using the deprecated "group:
os-apply-config".

This commit updates the templates. Doing so means they will also work
with the config-download deploy mechanism which only supports the
"group: script" method. This update allows us to move forward with
converting ci jobs that use these templates (such as ovb-ha) to use
config-download.

Change-Id: I23dcb9da36a609bcae57eabd7e072d094df5c884

commit_message:
Handle driver failures on create better.

Neutron-lbaas was leaving database objects behind on create calls if the
driver had a failure. This would lead to ghost objects in the database.
This patch fixes this such that if the driver raises an exception
the database object will be cleaned up.

Change-Id: I961280c6548bddc09c206130bdd8eb384fcad51b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 11:45:01.000000000', 'message': 'Ceilometer: start notification agent on step 5

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi. But we prepare
Gnocchi resource-types on step5 (during ceilometer-upgrade).

So we should not start it before Gnocchi resource types are prepared.

Related-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
'}, {'created': '2017-12-14 12:13:14.000000000', 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3.
* Doing the remaining storage/incoming upgrade of Gnocchi on step4 when
  swift is ready.
* Start pushing data to Gnocchi after ceilometer-upgrade is done.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a

"}, {'created': '2017-12-18 07:27:13.000000000', 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Partial-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a

"}, {'created': '2017-12-18 10:59:43.000000000', 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Add dependencies between ceilometer-upgrade and gnocchi-api in case of
  non multinode deployment.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
"}]
commit_message:
gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Add dependencies between ceilometer-upgrade and gnocchi-api in case of
  non multinode deployment.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a

commit_message:
Add support for getting volume details with a specified microversion

This allows us to get volume details and pass through a microversion.
This will be used to get a volume with microversion 3.48 where
the shared_targets and service_uuid parameters are in the response.
We will then use that information to determine if we should lock
attach/detach operations on that volume.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Ief30adfef35eefe03e5a3d3d9623cd48e4d334a4

Replace ujson with json

ujson has not had any active maintenance for the last 12 months;

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.
