"}]
commit_message:
Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a

The periodic task will get an admin context, the admin context will generate a
random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.context/tree/oslo_context/context.py#n263

And the DB method `action_event_start` will search previous action when it can't
find an action match that random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n5783

So this periodic task can execute correctly the admin context get a random requset
id, and the action event will attach to the previous 'shelve' action.

This reverts commit 35729ef50ccf5580d8661876d1bbe9b4fa94ffa8.

Change-Id: Ib330918e64c31cbb7de3829d3f220da812f2da2f
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Modify _poll_shelved_instances periodic task call _shelve_offload_instance()"

The periodic task will get an admin context, the admin context will generate a
random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.context/tree/oslo_context/context.py#n263

And the DB method `action_event_start` will search previous action when it can't
find an action match that random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n5783

So this periodic task can execute correctly the admin context get a random requset
id, and the action event will attach to the previous 'shelve' action.

This reverts commit 35729ef50ccf5580d8661876d1bbe9b4fa94ffa8.

Change-Id: Ib330918e64c31cbb7de3829d3f220da812f2da2f
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records

commit_message:
Add removal_policies_mode to ResourceGroup

This enables choice over the current behavior which is to always append
to the resource data blacklist, or overwrite it (which is sometimes needed
e.g if you decide you want to reuse that group index)

The default behavior is unchanged, but the new behavior can be selected
via the "update" value.

Change-Id: I1157627b07d98dd079657c320ad783a3ba5bce81
Closes-Bug: #1741053

commit_message:
Downgrade WARNING-level log

It's expected that when a resource completes and the traversal it was
processing is no longer active, we won't update the stack state in the
database. Therefore don't log at WARNING level for this routine event.

Change-Id: Ic901e46c251400c4eeb90a4d9ad4a97d61fb1af8

Remove oslosphinx

oslosphinx is obsolete as of

I3495ea4ff2b30cb3debbc3aaf0e73e9d2b6f4206

and will be dead as of Pike EOL.

openstackdocstheme takes its place

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 22:18:37.000000000', 'message': "Don't try resource-level locks when stack locked

The actions SUSPEND, RESUME, SNAPSHOT, and CHECK have not (yet) been
converted to the convergence workflow and still do a legacy-style
in-memory traversal with the Stack lock held, even on stacks with
convergence enabled. Since a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023 we
have been attempting to get a lock on the Resource to do these
operations, even though there is no engine ID set (which caused a
WARNING-level log). For these operations, respect existing Resource
locks when convergence is enabled, but don't try to acquire the lock.

Change-Id: I6f232380398a7caf9664717debfe39e3422e70d8
Related-Bug: #1662585

commit_message:
Don't try resource-level locks when stack locked

The actions SUSPEND, RESUME, SNAPSHOT, CHECK, and also DELETE when
abandoning rather than deleting a stack, have not (yet) been converted
to the convergence workflow and still do a legacy-style in-memory
traversal with the Stack lock held, even on stacks with convergence
enabled. Since a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023 we have been
attempting to get a lock on the Resource to do these operations, even
though there is no engine ID set (which caused a WARNING-level log). For
these operations, respect existing Resource locks when convergence is
enabled, but don't try to acquire the lock.

Change-Id: I6f232380398a7caf9664717debfe39e3422e70d8
Related-Bug: #1727142
Related-Bug: #1662585

Update tests to match expectations

In the change from py2 -> py3, some expectations around
file modes have changed,and this update changes the tests
to match those expectations.

commit_message:
Remove run-tests and py3-run-tests

We have standard jobs for doing unittests under python2 and python3 -
namely, the builtin tox environments py27 and py35. Just use those and
remove the locally defined jobs.

Depends-On: I6d7a96adf5cfb075f5a2ffbd089ccbb883a1c1b4
Change-Id: I0cc0c07daafba331a64861c134029e443ba2aa8d

commit_message:
update best practices

- remove 'prior to ocata' conditions.
- remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task as it doesn't work in
reality and is being removed.
- add a note when to enable workload_partitioning of notification
agent

Change-Id: I44c030835de1517a3c067ab0632c09f4a5fe2f15

fix doc build

Currently the neutron-specs doc build is failing due to unreferenced
citations (ex: [1]).

This patch removes the unused citations.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/31/473531/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/
66f70ee/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-03_20_13_24_616008

subject: fix gnocchi ceph name variable
messages:
[{'account_id': 27474, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:40:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:43:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for your first contribution! 

Gnocchi definitely needs some love.
If you're willing to help, we have this etherpad on. You can add your issue there.
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/osa-telemetry-stack-fixing

Please also see my comments below."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If I read the bug description, this isn't the place where things should get fixed.

The gnocchi_ceph_pool is a string variable, and it should stay that way.
However there is probably an automatic wiring in the group_vars that maps or at least should map openstack_gnocchi_pool.name to gnocchi_ceph_pool."}, {'account_id': 27474, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27474, 'date': '2018-01-03 13:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-03 16:41:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I am confused, why is this needed? This is not explained in the commit message.

For me gnocchi_ceph_pool is a string, and we should set the string appropriately.

What's the reason this isn't set properly? Please see also my first comment."}, {'account_id': 27474, 'date': '2018-01-04 15:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

irrelevant due to an error in our configuration.
Sorry for the inconvenience'}]

commit_message:
fix gnocchi ceph name variable

fixes a bug where the used ceph pool name variable refereced
a whole list/object instead of only the name portion of it.

added conditional to only use the gnocchi_ceph_pool.name
if it is defined

Change-Id: Id1515ecaefbd4b97f61500b48f585eed54483128

commit_message:
cleanup data-pipelines admin guide

- add a note mentioning transformers are not durable and you
might be able to use gnocchi
- explain how to enabled/disable pipelines.

Change-Id: I3f50d5b5a1e22a114ef2c8e17c1e659f1c0eb761

commit_message:
cleanup data collection admin guide

- remove list of notifications used for meters, it's not accurate
and is arguably of no value to an administrator even if it's
accurate. just list where the endpoints are and how to configure.
- remove comments about database connection, this means nothing
- remove libvirt comment, listing all services polled as these are
stated elsewhere and are just repeated.

Change-Id: If67ecf7e507da70abae3734618358c2458f49037

commit_message:
multinode: run overcloud-post-deploy tag

Run post overcloud deployment steps like a user would normally run.
The tasks were ignored until now because the tag was not specified.

Change-Id: Id07cc177cf8750da96e1903bfc509a460d18c6ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 20:37:49.000000000', 'message': "overcloud-post: introduce gnocchi_quick_policy

Adding gnocchi_quick_policy parameter (false by default).
When set to true, 2 commands will be run after having the overcloud
deployed:

gnocchi archive-policy create quick -d  granularity:15s,timespan:1day
gnocchi archive-policy-rule create -a quick -m cpu_util quick-rule

For now, we'll configure this policy in TripleO Quickstart, as we expect
the user to choose what's best for the deployment.

The boolean will be set to true on scenario001 so we can decrease the
runtime of the CI job.

Change-Id: I16825eacebb828059cea612089dbd1efe5d8e557

commit_message:
overcloud-post: introduce gnocchi_quick_policy

Adding gnocchi_quick_policy parameter (false by default).
When set to true, 2 commands will be run after having the overcloud
deployed:

gnocchi archive-policy create quick -d  granularity:15s,timespan:1day
gnocchi archive-policy-rule create -a quick -m cpu_util quick-rule

For now, we'll configure this policy in TripleO Quickstart, as we expect
the user to choose what's best for the deployment.
The boolean will be set to true on scenario001 so we can decrease the
runtime of the CI job.

Change-Id: I16825eacebb828059cea612089dbd1efe5d8e557

commit_message:
Run legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr in devstack experimental

This job runs with the latest release of libvirt which we need to
test libvirt 3.10 for multiattach support in devstack change
I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348.

Change-Id: I910d7952c80bcebb16ff8ddbe7b464d4fa44f310

commit_message:
Add neutron-vpnaas docs and release notes pub job to zuul layout

One of the requirements[1] for Neutron stadium projects is to have
in-tree developer documentation. This creates a stub for that. We can
expand on it once the stub is in, but this will permit us to set up
publishing while we iterate on it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#checklist

Change-Id: I55d016994fc41d61c415722872b58ed3823259ee

subject: add version fallback env var when no git upstream
messages:
[{'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-11-30 22:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-30 22:58:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-12-01 01:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

It makes sense to have this override and as a bonus it even matches what the documentation says

> and all version calculation logic will be completely skipped and the supplied version will be considered absolute.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-12-01 01:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks. What about adding a section in the documentation about this use case? I will put it in an additional change if you agree'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-05 18:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think the point of that variable is to override any discovery mechanism for downstream packagers who want to set their own version. Perhaps we need a different variable?'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-12-05 18:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree to create a new variable. In this case, I would add it at the very end in case _get_version_from_git fail to find version.

I however confirm this allows pbr to work in a docker build without git upstream access. I have a project where "active" dependencies are add with git submodules and installed with `pip install -e ./deps/mydependency`. Once these dependencies are stable enough, we will use pypi repository'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-12-05 20:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-12-05 20:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-09 16:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2017-12-09 17:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hello. I was wondering how it will behave when, say, my app uses 5 packages that use PBR, 2 of which are checkout by source (through git submodules for instance).

My requirements.txt might says it want a given PBR-using package in version >=1.0.0, another <1.0.0 an so on. So, for these packages, we need to move the PBR_VERSION check below the package metadata reading, so for these packages the version are right. I use that for the moment on my app, with 2 submodule version it works great. It allows me to use submodules for specifying the version of my modules currently being developed. We also have a CI that automatically update the reference on submodules update.

So, tell me which solution fit you best:
- keep PBR_VERSION but moved below the package version retrieval (like in my first proposal)
- same but with another variable (PBR_FALLBACK_VERSION ?). leaving PBR_VERSION in first position
- let the version being specified by package name, I am not sure if it makes sense actually, but if the name can take non alphanumeric character, I can strip them out with a regex for example.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-11 16:08:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Hello. I was wondering how it will behave when, say, my app uses 5
 > packages that use PBR, 2 of which are checkout by source (through
 > git submodules for instance).
 > 
 > My requirements.txt might says it want a given PBR-using package in
 > version >=1.0.0, another <1.0.0 an so on. So, for these packages,
 > we need to move the PBR_VERSION check below the package metadata
 > reading, so for these packages the version are right. I use that
 > for the moment on my app, with 2 submodule version it works great.
 > It allows me to use submodules for specifying the version of my
 > modules currently being developed. We also have a CI that
 > automatically update the reference on submodules update.
 > 
 > So, tell me which solution fit you best:
 > - keep PBR_VERSION but moved below the package version retrieval
 > (like in my first proposal)
 > - same but with another variable (PBR_FALLBACK_VERSION ?). leaving
 > PBR_VERSION in first position
 > - let the version being specified by package name, I am not sure if
 > it makes sense actually, but if the name can take non alphanumeric
 > character, I can strip them out with a regex for example.

I'm not sure gerrit comments are the best forum for working through the details on this. It sounds like you're using git submodules, which we don't really support in our CI, and which I don't have much experience with so I'm not sure exactly why they pose a special issue.

For our testing within OpenStack we only test unreleased libraries with the projects that consume them in integration tests, and we have a special script that sets up that test environment. Unit tests for server projects always install libraries from released packages.

It sounds like your needs are different from that, though. Maybe you can start a mailing list thread on openstack-dev to give us some more detail so we can understand what you're trying to do and either offer alternatives or see how adding support for this new variable solves your problem?"}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I found the issue: .git is not a folder in submodule, we need to include the root .git (instead of deps/<mydeps>/.git) in the docker (so work with the .Dockerignore)'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 22:58:31.000000000', 'message': 'allow version override only for non pkgmetadata

setting the environment variable «\xa0PBR_VERSION\xa0»
now only affects packages without pkg metadata.

This allows to use PBR in the following use case:
- project with submodules, especially «\xa0deps\xa0»
  directory with under development «\xa0shared\xa0»
  libraries.
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  «\xa0upstream git repository\xa0».

This patch allows me to define the environment
variable «\xa0PBR_VERSION\xa0» to something random
while still not affect other libraries that uses of pbr.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 20:13:30.000000000', 'message': 'allow version override only for non pkgmetadata

setting the environment variable

    PBR_<packagename>_FALLBACK_VERSION

allows to use PBR in the following use case:
- project with submodules, especially «\xa0deps\xa0»
  directory with under development «\xa0shared\xa0»
  libraries.
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  «\xa0upstream git repository\xa0».

This patch allows me to define the environment
variable «\xa0PBR_VERSION\xa0» to something random
while still not affect other libraries that uses of pbr.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 20:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'add version fallback env var when no git upstream

setting the environment variable

    PBR_<PACKAGENAME>_FALLBACK_VERSION

allows user to tell PBR the version of a package
even when the git version calculation fail.

Example in the following use case:
- project with some python dependencies in
  git submodules located in a «\xa0deps\xa0»
  directory at the root of a project using PBR
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
  and so, the CI handles the git project +
  submodule check out, and does not provide
  access to upstream git during the docker build.
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  «\xa0upstream git repository\xa0».

In the previous example, with this patch,
one only has to define

    PBR_ MYDEPENDENCY_FALLBACK_VERSION

to have PBR versioning calculation using
git history to fail and take this version string.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>
'}]
commit_message:
add version fallback env var when no git upstream

setting the environment variable

    PBR_<PACKAGENAME>_FALLBACK_VERSION

allows user to tell PBR the version of a package
even when the git version calculation fail.

Example in the following use case:
- project with some python dependencies in
  git submodules located in a « deps »
  directory at the root of a project using PBR
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
  and so, the CI handles the git project +
  submodule check out, and does not provide
  access to upstream git during the docker build.
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  « upstream git repository ».

In the previous example, with this patch,
one only has to define

    PBR_ MYDEPENDENCY_FALLBACK_VERSION

to have PBR versioning calculation using
git history to fail and take this version string.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>

commit_message:
Add import of cluster templates to GUI.

Partially-Implements: bp portable-node-group-and-cluster-templates

This change adds button "Import Template"
to cluster templates tab in dashboard.

commit f04ba178dfba1fd32b5a3907860aea11d4a4cbba stopped jobs

django_openstack_auth.

'}]
commit_message:
Add noop job for django_openstack_auth master branch

commit f04ba178dfba1fd32b5a3907860aea11d4a4cbba stopped jobs
for django_openstack_auth master branch, but it seems at least
one job is required to get +1 from Zuul verified job.
This commit defines noop job for the master branch of
django_openstack_auth.

Change-Id: I626a4aae1a8083fb0ca5946e61320084ed722369

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 11:17:34.000000000', 'message': "Wait for found shard ranges to be replicated before cleaving

After finding new scan ranges on the leader node we weren't waiting
for the leader's db to be replicated before proceeding to cleave.
Worse, we weren't setting Scan-Done=True until *after* spawning the
replication job. It seems that things worked out because the
replication thread typically ran after Scan-Done had been set. In
fact, the probe test meta_timestamp assertions only passed because the
replication of the leader db occurred after cleaving had completed, so
all replicas got the leader's cleaved meta_timestamps.

This change sets Scan-Done before replicating and adds a wait so that
we know the leader's found shard ranges and Scan-Done state have been
replicated before proceeding with the sharding state machine. That
makes it easier to reason about the state of each node.

Change-Id: I5b75189cf1b2a9f04bcd44893d5d212a6524481a
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for found shard ranges to be replicated before cleaving

After finding new scan ranges on the leader node we weren't waiting
for the leader's db to be replicated before proceeding to cleave.
Worse, we weren't setting Scan-Done=True until *after* spawning the
replication job. It seems that things worked out because the
replication thread typically ran after Scan-Done had been set. In
fact, the probe test meta_timestamp assertions only passed because the
replication of the leader db occurred after cleaving had completed, so
all replicas got the leader's cleaved meta_timestamps.

This change sets Scan-Done before replicating and adds a wait so that
we know the leader's found shard ranges and Scan-Done state have been
replicated before proceeding with the sharding state machine. That
makes it easier to reason about the state of each node.

Change-Id: I5b75189cf1b2a9f04bcd44893d5d212a6524481a

messages:
[{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-01-04 00:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-01-04 08:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 00:13:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix differing bootstrap uuids

When is_bootstrapped is consulted it was returning a false negative.
When the leader node is bootstrapped it sets the uuid via leader_set,
but during a leader-settings-changed hook when the non-leader should
be picking up the uuid it was checking relation data instead which will
be way behind the curve. This is a vestigial block of code
pre-leadership.

Leader settings get set much earlier than relation data. This change
consults leader_get rather than the relation. We also make sure the
mysqld.cnf file is rendered on a leader-settings-changed hook.

Change-Id: I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94
Closes-Bug: #1738896
'}]
commit_message:
Fix differing bootstrap uuids

When is_bootstrapped is consulted it was returning a false negative.
When the leader node is bootstrapped it sets the uuid via leader_set,
but during a leader-settings-changed hook when the non-leader should
be picking up the uuid it was checking relation data instead which will
be way behind the curve. This is a vestigial block of code
pre-leadership.

Leader settings get set much earlier than relation data. This change
consults leader_get rather than the relation. We also make sure the
mysqld.cnf file is rendered on a leader-settings-changed hook.

Change-Id: I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94
Closes-Bug: #1738896

commit_message:
Ensure config changes are applied

Currently any config changes post-deployment are
ignored once the domain name is set. This patch
ensures that any changes are registered and applied.

Change-Id: Id37db3c74d3712bc96c3f8ed6a04c907e4d18bc5
Closes-Bug: #1712972

commit_message:
Re-factor and improve update_networks_matching_iface_port

* Implement _find_best_match() using subset intersection.
* Reduce number of expensive external neutron calls to get net_id by
  moving this outside the inner loop.

Unit test updated, we now do a better job at matching and populate more
data when updating.

Partial-Bug: #1696483
Partial-Bug: #1702279
Change-Id: I2157d35e1c58f3960d5b6aa86199d93bb5b88401

commit_message:
finish qos_rule_type_details extension api-ref

The current api-ref for qos_rule_type_details is incomplete; see bug
description.
This patch completes the qos_rule_type_details api-ref by documenting
the extension and ensuring the 'drivers' param is documented and
included in the sample JSON responses.

Change-Id: I954cf8e11ac5a075f3cd423104f6a2b2c1eb7710
Closes-Bug: #1733387

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27584, 'date': '2018-01-04 10:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages
messages:
[{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2017-12-15 10:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-12-15 13:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is this really a problem? I guess I don't see a big problem in the sample output given::

    Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..


If this is really a problem, then IMO we need to do a better/full 'scrub' of the code in neutron-lib. For example:

- There are some still with periods in validators.
- All the api specific validators need the same treatment.
- We probably need to do the same for all converters.
- Hypothetically we could do all user facing exception messages; no?"}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2017-12-28 09:46:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks boden for the review! 

> Is this really a problem? I guess I don't see a big problem in the
 > sample output given::
 > 
 > Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..
 > 

It is not a big deal. However IMHO the duplicate period at the end should be considered as typo, no? 

For the port range part, it looks like the extra periods are added (by mistake?) during the migration [1]. See the removal in neutron-fwaas [2].

 > If this is really a problem, then IMO we need to do a better/full
 > 'scrub' of the code in neutron-lib. For example:

Sounds like a right way to go.

 > 
 > - There are some still with periods in validators.
 > - All the api specific validators need the same treatment.

Couldn't find any msg returned by other validators contains an extra period at the end.

 > - We probably need to do the same for all converters.
 > - Hypothetically we could do all user facing exception messages;
 > no?

These two can be outside the scope of this patchset, or we can only do the scrub at once?

For converters, same as validators, the error message would be part of the InvalidInput exception message, thus no extra period at the end is needed. Luckily only one exception is found [3].

For exceptions, the message itself would be the message reported thus all the messages of the exceptions should end with a period. Some exceptions are found [4].

[1] If49391647dfa0cb1eeca4c80abdc7397eb639675
[2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/9d9799f20ca202ceeb8354a6817c856c26434869#diff-baab995ceccad5ad0e7c3284393d8be5L144
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/4c49003bb8aa08bde8d8d760d7435d6c48609709/neutron_lib/api/converters.py#L99
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5E%5B%5E%23%5D.*%5B%5E%5C.%5D%5C%22%5C)&i=nope&files=neutron_lib%2Fexceptions&repos=neutron-lib"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-28 20:50:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I know that it is trivial change but IMO it's good to fix it If someone proposed that :)
@boden: I was also checking in other messages in validators and I didn't found any other messages with dot at the end (maybe I was looking wrong)"}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-02 13:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here's the other validators/converters I see using a period. Perhaps we can just address these in this patch if everyone agrees?


- https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py#L559
- https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/validators/allowedaddresspairs.py#L43
- https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/converters.py#L99"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-02 13:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>
'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-02 13:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

thx boden. I missed them somehow.
I agree with You that we should fix them all together'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-03 04:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Here's the other validators/converters I see using a period.
 > Perhaps we can just address these in this patch if everyone agrees?
 > 

Thanks boden.

 > - https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py#L559

This one ends with the msg from validate_ip_address validator. So there would be no extra period as validate_ip_address don't return such a msg.

 > - https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/validators/allowedaddresspairs.py#L43

This string is used for webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest and not wrapped in other strings, so no change is needed here.

 > - https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/converters.py#L99

I also noticed this one(see my previous comment). As this commit was at first only trying to fix those in validators I didn't include this one. I agree with you that this one can be fixed in this patch. Will update."}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-03 05:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-03 08:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-03 14:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-01-04 08:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 10:53:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove periods at the end of validator messages

The caller of validators takes the validation error message as the
reason in the format "Invalid input for %(attr)s. Reason: %(reason)s.".
Thus the extra period at the end of a validation error message should be
removed to avoid duplication.

An example for reference:

$ openstack firewall group rule create --source-port BEEF --protocol tcp
Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I76bfed5a91cb569119e1e83ee3bf3917bb526e79
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 05:40:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages

Messages fixed in this commit are wrapped at the end of other messages,
where the outer messages themselves have periods at the end. Thus the
extra periods of these messages should be removed to avoid duplication
in user facing messages.

An example for reference:

$ openstack firewall group rule create --source-port BEEF --protocol tcp
Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I76bfed5a91cb569119e1e83ee3bf3917bb526e79
'}]
commit_message:
Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages

Messages fixed in this commit are wrapped at the end of other messages,
where the outer messages themselves have periods at the end. Thus the
extra periods of these messages should be removed to avoid duplication
in user facing messages.

An example for reference:

$ openstack firewall group rule create --source-port BEEF --protocol tcp
Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I76bfed5a91cb569119e1e83ee3bf3917bb526e79

commit_message:
Make sure we only run tempest-full on master

Since tempest-full is part of the integrated gate, it is executed
against all stable branches. However since stable branches will
not get roles from master anymore this does not work.

We may want to backport all devstack ansbile changes, but in the
meanwhile this ensures that a working job is executed against
stable branches.

Change-Id: I5d34e5b983b720dc1913d00ccc1a16d81a040d49
Partial-bug: #1739829

commit_message:
fix the tempest failure for external ceph

show_multiple_locations is missing for external ceph, and it will
cause tempest run failed.
it means the conditon for show_multiple_locations is
glance_backend_ceph but not enable_ceph, this patch it fix it.

Change-Id: I3c95c3b0a7e34639b376bdfd0205f3930b06e2cd
Closes-Bug: #1741022
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 14:05:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix failure handling in prechecks

In two precheck tasks, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), there will be no stdout
attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix
"}, {'created': '2017-12-14 13:43:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix failure handling in prechecks

In a HAProxy precheck task, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), in some cases there may not be a
stdout attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix
"}, {'created': '2017-12-14 14:06:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix failure handling in prechecks

In a HAProxy precheck task, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), in some cases there may not be a
stdout attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failure handling in prechecks

In a HAProxy precheck task, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), in some cases there may not be a
stdout attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix

commit_message:
Add tempurl to swift pipeline

This is required for some tempest tests and in turn to achieve 100%
refstack certification for clouds deployed by Kolla. tempurl is default in
Swift[0] but we're missing as we override the pipeline.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/\
    b86bf15a644db4438770801a312fe074a09c91ef/\
    etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L97

Change-Id: I0e36fcd7a785f878005d51159eb51725c284229c

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I84cee5a9a728b9d6dc7909ac28a60b9c20c2348c

subject: Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form
messages: [{'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2018-01-03 21:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2018-01-04 01:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-04 03:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24056, 'date': '2018-01-04 07:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-04 09:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 21:55:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form

The value of the 'volume_type' is determined by the 'volumeType'
object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the
'volumeType' object changes. However, the current value of the
'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value
of 'volume_type' is empty, when we switch volume types drop-down box,
its value is also empty, only change the name, description, size and
availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.html#L45
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js#L140

Change-Id: If754d0c2ced844414c35829d4cefa1fb861522d5
Closes-Bug:#1737900
(cherry picked from commit 3aee4cbac666f080133671790baa9dd42223c996)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form

The value of the 'volume_type' is determined by the 'volumeType'
object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the
'volumeType' object changes. However, the current value of the
'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value
of 'volume_type' is empty, when we switch volume types drop-down box,
its value is also empty, only change the name, description, size and
availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.html#L45
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js#L140

Change-Id: If754d0c2ced844414c35829d4cefa1fb861522d5
Closes-Bug:#1737900
(cherry picked from commit 3aee4cbac666f080133671790baa9dd42223c996)

commit_message:
Fix alertmanager serviceaccountname reference

Alertmanager's serviceaccountname was hardcoded instead of using
the common definition used in other charts. This simply brings the
chart in line with the others

Change-Id: I81fa6814217f2e422617379d5e3bf3629f660407

commit_message:
Add test for assignment of uuid to a deleted BDM

We eventually want to make the BDM uuid column not nullable. This
will require that there are no null values in the column, including in
deleted BDMs. This change adds a test which asserts the online
migration correctly assigns a uuid to soft deleted BDMs.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: Icf7dd4e3ecf0257d59f82cea80f76f12495594db

commit_message:
Update monasca driver to use keystoneauth1

Use of keystone client removed and replaced with
new standard method of using keystoneauth1 in
datasource_utils.

Updated the way service endpoint is retrieved from
keystone, using keystone session rather than
keystone client.

Also cleaned up the confusing overloading of self.creds
for poll_time and other unrelated uses.

Change-Id: I6cd1daa3de0d7483c2f17e30a6b80ae41907444b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 14:24:31.000000000', 'message': "monasca-ui: add drilldown subpackage

monasca-ui comes with a scripted Grafana dashboard for Grafana
2.x and higher that can be used for alarm drilldown links.
This commit adds the grafana-monasca-drilldown subpackage that
installs this scripted dashboard into Grafana's dashboard
directory.

Change-Id: I66361d3d6009311964f4183de7cda7dcf7872292
(cherry picked from commit ddf76a49fd42dfc647b1e8ddcfa501cbb8c0f22d)

commit_message:
monasca-ui: add drilldown subpackage

monasca-ui comes with a scripted Grafana dashboard for Grafana
2.x and higher that can be used for alarm drilldown links.
This commit adds the grafana-monasca-drilldown subpackage that
installs this scripted dashboard into Grafana's dashboard
directory.

Change-Id: I66361d3d6009311964f4183de7cda7dcf7872292
(cherry picked from commit ddf76a49fd42dfc647b1e8ddcfa501cbb8c0f22d)

commit_message:
Don't overwrite device_id of existing port

Right now, we use libnetwork endpoint ID as the device_id of
neutron port. However, if the neutron port is pre-created by users,
users might want to customize the value of device_id. A use case is
to set the device_id as the ID of the container so that users can
list ports belonging to a specific container.

This patch proposes to perserve the device_id of existing neutron
ports if the device_id is not empty.

Change-Id: I9cdfdb0b0db6bf9ab0983144a0d7f0dc5ecbd05f

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.

or zypper install package.

commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I65dc0ee8e5d9c5558098c32866bab3d372fd095a

commit_message:
Have cluster actions respect node name formatter

This patch adds logic so that when a cluster is scaled out (or its
size is to be increased as a result cluster-resize), the newly created
nodes also respects the name formatter set in the cluster.config.

Change-Id: I32e458f3bc5481257c8ca22a4564b3ecdab20000

command line.

messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-01-03 21:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-01-03 21:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-04 05:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 21:19:41.000000000', 'message': "Only copy openafs centos rpms if we built them

The openafs centos packaging job only builds new rpms if the desired
version doesn't have an rpm published. Otherwise it short circuits and
the job ends. Unfortunately the post tasks assume the rpm will always be
built so this job then fails. Fix this by checking for rpms before
running the post tasks.

Change-Id: I132b82d437a19f855a49d175a912792417a85ae9
"}]
commit_message:
Only copy openafs centos rpms if we built them

The openafs centos packaging job only builds new rpms if the desired
version doesn't have an rpm published. Otherwise it short circuits and
the job ends. Unfortunately the post tasks assume the rpm will always be
built so this job then fails. Fix this by checking for rpms before
running the post tasks.

Change-Id: I132b82d437a19f855a49d175a912792417a85ae9

commit_message:
Deprecate testr and nose integration

These are not recommended for use in OpenStack anymore and both nose and
testr offer native setuptools commands that can be manually aliased to
'test' on a per-project basis if necessary. Deprecate with an eye to
removal in the future.

Change-Id: I753f2ffe8b223b180b8ed813d879b3a28b47a1ab
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Optimize inconsistency detection (Part 1)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23458, 'name': 'Dong Jun', 'email': 'dongjun.01@bytedance.com', 'username': 'Dongj'}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-06 11:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-06 13:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-11-14 13:26:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I believe you explained it to me, but there's no way of storing revision in OVSDB side instead?"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-14 13:52:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi, Miguel

Yes, it is stored there as well, in the previous patch of this chain: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517049/4/networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py@1040

This patch is a way to optimize the detection of resources that are out of sync. For example, if we only save the revision number in the external_ids of OVNDB in order to verify if the resources are sync we would need to:

1) Fetch every single resource
2) Check it against the standardattributes table in NeutronDB

Now, if we add a new table to the neutron database and also save the revision numbers referent to the OVN resources there we can optmize the detection by just doing a JOIN between this new table and the standardattributes table in the Neutron database, it's much more performatic.

So the way I see it working would be:

1) Update the resources in OVN and include the rev number in the external_ids of that resource

2) If the transaction was committed successfully (no exceptions raised) update the ovn_revision_numbers table with that save revision numbers

There could be a case in 2) where the OVS transaction gets committed successfully but we fail to write to the neutron database (for whatever reason). But, that shouldn't be a problem either. While the resource will be detected as out of sync, before we try to fix it the code can check the revision number in the OVNDB (the source of truth) and compare it what is in the standardattributes table in the NeutronDB. If the numbers match, we just fix the new table, if not, we sync the resource.

Hope it does clarify it."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-20 11:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-21 12:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-21 17:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-18 16:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

While I'm still catching up with this, I want to share what I've found so far testing this:

1. Created testnet1, testnet2, testnet3
2. Checked out your patch
3. Restarted neutron-server
4. Upgraded DB
5. Created testnet_new
6. Checked that only revision number existed for testnet_new
7. Attempted to delete testnet_new took 53 seconds

Details here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/629655/"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-22 14:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-22 14:42:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

This is what I got so far about the >50 seconds deleting 'old' networks:

* On delete_network_precommit, network segments are attempted to be deleted [0].
* This will make _handle_segment_change method to be called in the plugin, which will notify mechanism drivers about this change [1] even though there're no segments to delete.
* And this will update the network [2]
* In this patch we're trying to bump the revision number on network update [3], but it doesn't exist because it's an 'old' network.
* As it doesn't exist, ensure_revision_row_exists fails and tries to create the initial revision for this object at [4] but it fails 'Lock wait timeout exceeded'.
* The operation gets retried but looks like it's too late and the update_network_precommit fails 

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/services/segments/db.py#L315
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1898
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1915
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517918/11/networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py@941
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517918/11/networking_ovn/db/revision.py@93"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-22 15:14:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> This is what I got so far about the >50 seconds deleting 'old'
 > networks:
 > 
 > * On delete_network_precommit, network segments are attempted to be
 > deleted [0].
 > * This will make _handle_segment_change method to be called in the
 > plugin, which will notify mechanism drivers about this change [1]
 > even though there're no segments to delete.
 > * And this will update the network [2]
 > * In this patch we're trying to bump the revision number on network
 > update [3], but it doesn't exist because it's an 'old' network.
 > * As it doesn't exist, ensure_revision_row_exists fails and tries
 > to create the initial revision for this object at [4] but it fails
 > 'Lock wait timeout exceeded'.
 > * The operation gets retried but looks like it's too late and the
 > update_network_precommit fails
 > 
 > [0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/services/segments/db.py#L315
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1898
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1915
 > [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517918/11/networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py@941
 > [4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517918/11/networking_ovn/db/revision.py@93

Amending my previous comment, [2] should be https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1917

As Lucas pointed out on IRC, looks like this post-commit method is being invoked from the pre-commit of the network delete operation and this is the root cause of the lock since a session is already open."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-22 15:35:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Workflow-1

Hi @Daniel,

I think I found the problem and it's IMHO a bug in Neutron. 

What seems to be happening is, as part of the process to delete the network Neutron will delete the segments. But, there's a callback handler for the segments here [0] which invokes the update_network_postcommit() while the session to delete the network is still ACTIVE. So it's not a postcommit operation.

I could workaround this problem by checking if the session is or is not active here [1].

We have two options actually: 1. We could, ignore updates to OVN when the session is active since that only happens on the delete and we do not care about segments being deleted, like [1]. 

Or, 2. we could go ahead with the update by passing the active session to the ovn_client.update_network() and reusing it to bump the revision number.

I think we should go with 1., because again, we don't care about those segments being deleted.

What do you think ?

Meanwhile, opening a bug against neutron would be good.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6cdd079f8f3e6994734fa806b3c819cecb5f521a/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L1916-L1917 
[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/629661/"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-22 15:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

Dong, Daniel, Miguel,

Thanks guys, all reviews I'm getting for these series of patches have been amazing. It's being very beneficial!"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-22 16:00:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Optimize inconsistency detection (Part 1)

Create the database model and migration scripts for saving the revision
number of the OVN objects in the Neutron database.

Update the methods related to the network resource to use the new table.

Next patches in the series will use this new table to detect when the
resource is out of sync and fix it.

Related-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Id14e9e8b88797acec11b72117c6985c49ea713c9

commit_message:
Make the allowed_address_pairs driver better

The allowed address pairs network driver did not handle having objects
already deleted properly and would prematurely fail.
This patch improves the edge case handling of the driver.

Change-Id: Ice15aa2d6309648da43d6a40ce0286d5dce17500
Story: 2001258
Task: 5791
(cherry picked from commit ab0fe776d854fdf7970eb96efb32ac1a8a9e26a5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 18:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Omit error_summary if exc_info=False was explicitly passed

Currently, when logging at level >= WARNING, exception information is
added to the log message even when exc_info=False is explicitly passed.
In standard logging [1], if the exc_info keyword argument does not
evaluate as false, it causes exception information to be added to the
logging message.

This adds a check for exc_info=False and returns an empty string for
the error_summary in that case.

Closes-Bug: #1729475

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.Logger.debug

Change-Id: I2e4e356d23dff2e6ac1946fe9e994c4d962ab55a
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 21:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'Truncate error_summary if exc_info not explicitly passed

Currently, when logging at level >= WARNING, exception information is
added to the log message as an "error summary" for operators. The error
summary includes the exception type and the message. However, when the
exception is a _Remote exception generated from oslo.messaging and sent
over RPC, the full traceback from the exception is appended to the
exception message [1] to preserve it. So, the error summary ends up
outputting the full traceback, unintentionally.

This truncates the error_summary to keep only the first line unless
exc_info was explicitly passed, via LOG.exception(), for example.

Closes-Bug: #1729475

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/8d42484/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L208

Change-Id: I2e4e356d23dff2e6ac1946fe9e994c4d962ab55a
'}]
commit_message:
Truncate error_summary if exc_info not explicitly passed

Currently, when logging at level >= WARNING, exception information is
added to the log message as an "error summary" for operators. The error
summary includes the exception type and the message. However, when the
exception is a _Remote exception generated from oslo.messaging and sent
over RPC, the full traceback from the exception is appended to the
exception message [1] to preserve it. So, the error summary ends up
outputting the full traceback, unintentionally.

This truncates the error_summary to keep only the first line unless
exc_info was explicitly passed, via LOG.exception(), for example.

Closes-Bug: #1729475

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/8d42484/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L208

Change-Id: I2e4e356d23dff2e6ac1946fe9e994c4d962ab55a

commit_message:
WIP - deploy-overcloud/config-download: up to 4 nodes support

This is WIP now, I don't think we should do this thing here, in
quickstart extras, that way but this is a short way of supporting more
than 2 nodes for deploying with config-download.

Change-Id: I349fb9103653f7535dc648ab99895b4f63642e10

commit_message:
Deprecate API extensions policies

Nova API extension concept is removed in Pike. These extensions
have their own policies enforcement which are not needed any more.

All the below policies which were added mainly for extensions are
deprecated for removal-
        - 'os_compute_api:os-config-drive'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-availability-zone'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-status'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-volumes'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-keypairs'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-server-usage'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-security-groups' (only from /servers APIs)
        - 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-rxtx'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-access' (only from /flavors APIs)
        - 'os_compute_api:image-size'

Implement blueprint api-extensions-policy-removal

Depends-On: I6aed4909b0e7efe9c95d1f7398db613eca05e5ce

Change-Id: Ie05f4e84519f8a00ffb66ea5ee920d5c7722a66b

commit_message:
Include ingress entries in manifests key for kibana

Kibana was missing entries for enabling the ingress and ingress
service. This adds the entries in the manifests key for kibana

Change-Id: I12bdf0f2f82f7e666c8c058aacb798dbd22c3ff7

I don't think this is a good path for the project and I don't get what the point of this patch is?  It's just swapping one constant for another and moving validation around.
The point of the project is to have a stable, well known, API that is fully tested.  This seems to go counter to that."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-21 18:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-21 18:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

The thing is, this doesn't change the signature of the function -- just possible values. It's not ideal, but I can't think of any other way to allow providers to support their full feature-sets. EG, because we only have an haproxy solution (which doesn't support UDP loadbalancing), that means no third-party can possibly support it? I don't think that's a fair model in reality, as much as we'd love to have everything be "just perfect" for us...'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-21 18:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-21 19:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Allow using custom enum values for API fields

Some vendor drivers support things we don't expose directly, like UDP
protocol loadbalancing. This would allow us to query the handler to
determine feature support during API operations.

We move validation to the controller for specific fields (probably there
will need to be more fields implemented using this pattern) and allow
each provider to override the list of "supported" values for each field.

This patch also finally splits up POOL and LISTENER protocol constants,
as they should really be distinct lists.

Change-Id: I41c414474e2e56fb6500e9686a8f4ab72ac32cda

commit_message:
Make sure we only run tempest-full on master

Change [1] made the project run conditionally only master branches but
that seems ineffective [2]. Need branch matcher expression for skip-files
condition to ensure that job is indeed skipped on stable branches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530915/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/57/530857/1/check/tempest-full/6a17ce3/

Change-Id: Id84fd1eb6a8c24e23e871ea97a9a95e05c0f8cd8
Partial-bug: #1739829

commit_message:
use new payload objects for *_INIT callbacks

Part of the work we did while rehoming the callback modules introduced
the notion of payload objects [1] to replace the unstructured kwargs
used today. When using payloads event sources need to use publish()
rather than notify() to trigger the callback(s) and pass along a payload
object (if needed).

This patch begins to move us onto the payload objects by updating
BEFORE_INIT and AFTER_INIT event types to use the payloads.

Depends-On: I9194c7857f10392149159071cda8e080e93adc10

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/doc/source/devref/callbacks.rst#event-payloads

commit_message:
Fix sorting in Python 3

Ordering comparison operators in python 3 throws an error if trying to
compare different types (e.g. NoneType and str). Add a parameter to cast
sort values to a type for so that comparison operators work.

Partial-Bug: #1736696
Change-Id: I2aab5cc1f550848bda2b90ef7ef9a60f07b88996

commit_message:
Prevent cinder conf from copy nfs_shares to unrelated nodes

Prevent cinder conf from copy nfs_shares to all nodes instead of
just cinder-volume.

Change-Id: I4f94b6c0ca8b628c1babee7fff0b66fb5a8df257
Closes-Bug: #1713010

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-29 16:16:07.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph: Dont create volume pool by default

The Cinder chart can now manage its storage init itself. This PS
now removes the unrequired pool creation in the Ceph bootstrap job.
It also updates the `ensure_pool` to better support luminious.

Change-Id: I4a71df9a6d3a0e45c6ef6812926d66455055ae9f
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph: Dont create volume pool by default

The Cinder chart can now manage its storage init itself. This PS
now removes the unrequired pool creation in the Ceph bootstrap job.
It also updates the `ensure_pool` to better support luminious.

Change-Id: I4a71df9a6d3a0e45c6ef6812926d66455055ae9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 15:26:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bypass list length check when all values are None

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527001/ bypassed the None
list but did not consider the case where all the for_each lists are
getting their values from attributes and therefore are None.

This patch set fix it by also skipping the check if all the values
are None -- as value_lens would be 0 in that case.

Closes-bug: #1732934
Change-Id: Iba574bbd3877f9ca1ca755c384b3ddb47aec711c
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 15:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bypass list length check when all values are None

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527001/ bypassed the None
list but did not consider the case where all the for_each lists are
getting their values from attributes and therefore are None.

This patch set fix it by also skipping the check if all the values
are None -- as len(value_lens) would be 0 in that case.

Closes-bug: #1732934
Change-Id: Iba574bbd3877f9ca1ca755c384b3ddb47aec711c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bypass list length check when all values are None

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527001/ bypassed the None
list but did not consider the case where all the for_each lists are
getting their values from attributes and therefore are None.

This patch set fix it by also skipping the check if all the values
are None -- as len(value_lens) would be 0 in that case.

Closes-bug: #1732934
Change-Id: Iba574bbd3877f9ca1ca755c384b3ddb47aec711c

[{'created': '2017-11-28 03:41:49.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Ifb81fc7dd7dca02487b9e8d38d7b8de738ddeac5

commit_message:
Make enabled filenames consistent

Previously _2150_admin_flavor_panel.py used double underscores,
but there is no reason to use double underscores.
This commit makes the enabled filenames consistent.

Change-Id: I9c2de7075c715c1c41798c098e97560c14a554be

commit_message:
Show updated data on Flavor Access tab

Memoization for api flavor_access_list should be limited
to request so the updated data is shown after it's
modified.

Closes-bug: #1705958
Change-Id: Icf6716854502c2462569e12f00414950c915ca9b
(cherry picked from commit 221d1a25a483894a523cc82c9f3f54d025896586)

[{'created': '2017-11-29 16:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix setup_project checking out eol with branch name

A recent change to devstack-gate to enable falling back to EOL tags for
zuulv2 has a bug in it where it will try to checkout the stable/branch
instead of the converted eol tag. This patch addresses that issue.

Change-Id: I23330884da09befc3bca10973cbfd2ea9b666430
'}]
commit_message:
Fix setup_project checking out eol with branch name

A recent change to devstack-gate to enable falling back to EOL tags for
zuulv2 has a bug in it where it will try to checkout the stable/branch
instead of the converted eol tag. This patch addresses that issue.

commit_message:
Switch to Subnet OVO in ipam_backend_mixin _save_subnet method

This patch switch to use Subnet OVO in
ipam_backend_mixin.IpamBackendMixin._save_subnet
method.

To use Subnet OVO there, additional changes in _make_subnet_args()
method are also required. Now this method returns:
* 'project_id' instead of 'tenant_id',
* 'cidr' as instance of netaddr.IPNetwork,
* 'gateway_ip' as instance of netaddr.IPAddress

Change-Id: I9fb284e98394b1a41ec8af919b65dc512663ff6a
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Make stackenv file visible

The file won't be listed as long as it is called .stackenv.txt.gz, with
this it will be called _stackenv.txt.gz instead.

commit_message:
Move commands to the base testenv

This should allow py27 and py35 to both work in parallel while we remove
the run-tests versions.

Add the new jobs here, even though the next patch will remove them,
since we can't verify the new jobs work with depends-on to
project-config.

Change-Id: I78cfadf5a3b9822ce32f5a1d9b76321d573618ab

commit_message:
Update AnsibleGenerateInventoryAction to match new mistral interfaces

Ife653558bfcda794e7f37086832f70b0ad7c28a4 changed the way this data is
represented, now there's a nested context with the security data in,
and the old interfaces are deprecated.

Change-Id: Id0ba10d1192314187bedb14998d4aadc5fb91ef5
Closes-Bug: 1740891

commit_message:
cleanup admin-guide architecture

- remove reference to api
- remove dup details on compute, central, ipmi already in data
collection
- remove hbase from panko support
- remove listing libvirt hypervisors, we only test kvm/qemu.
- remove generic listing of 'OpenStack Networking' meters. we already
have a measurements page for this
- remove user, roles, projects notes. we don't have api and it
means very little as is

Change-Id: I292cdd9297549ab8cb78caf6b15941b3986ca898
(cherry picked from commit 5b85f02bd6d099ccf5e6c450cff70c4722c1487c)

(but we should add to it)

Change-Id: I647a84e2d29f00a8c64c42914939d60cc8aa6ebe

commit_message:
Added scenario: spawn instance with port associated to security group

This test creates two ports on the same network, with a pre-made
security group, and then spawning two instances and assigning
them with the ports created - to verify that the security group is
inherited and enforced.

Change-Id: I40f8b0cac360594a65fb9f6023930af3322cac58

commit_message:
Start using Connection in openstack.cloud

Now that it's all one big happy tree, it's time to start using
Connection instead of direct Adapters in the old shade calls. This is a baby
step towards that.

The _munch_response + _get_and_munchify is clearly a terrible pattern.
We'll likely want to shift to using the actual SDK object layer, but
let's taking it a bit at a time.

This replaces all usage of _compute_client with _conn.compute. Amazingly
only one test broke, and that only broke because the test was broken and
removing an Exception rethrow caused it to be properly seen.

Change-Id: Ice60b2343ba30520bc27bef09ee9d5d7ad19411f

Bandit only checks if imports is done using keyword ``import`` or
``__import__()`` and does not check for blacklisted module loaded
via importlib.  This patch set adds additional check for blacklisted
modules loaded via importlib.

Change-Id: I97ed93af1066fa39dfc5be0868ab814c8eadd147
Closes-Bug: #1718516
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}]
commit_message:
Add module loaded through importlib

Bandit only checks if imports is done using keyword ``import`` or
``__import__()`` and does not check for blacklisted module loaded
via importlib.  This patch set adds additional check for blacklisted
modules loaded via importlib.

Change-Id: I97ed93af1066fa39dfc5be0868ab814c8eadd147
Closes-Bug: #1718516
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

[{'created': '2017-11-15 20:49:43.000000000', 'message': "use multi provider net api def from neutron-lib

The multi provider net extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the extensions parent class.

NeutronLibImpact

The multi provider net extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the extensions parent class.

NeutronLibImpact

commit_message:
Update HAProxy default timeout values

The default HAProxy timeout values are fairly strict. On a busy cloud
it is common to exceed one or more of these timeouts. The only
indication that HAProxy has exceeded a timeout and dropped the
connection is errors such as "BadStatusLine" or "EOF." These can be
very difficult to diagnose when intermittent.

This charm-helpers sync pulls in the change to update the default
timeout values to more real world settings. These values have been
extensively tested in ServerStack. Configured values will not be
overridden.

Partial Bug: #1736171

Change-Id: I5f602a8dc1ab1060696fd486beb66033efaae862

[{'created': '2017-08-09 21:14:49.000000000', 'message': "suppress deprecation warning

As of today OSC doesn't support a way for plugging in client-side
code that can handle API attribute extensions as outlined in the related
bug report.

For those projects that do implement API attribute extensions, users
rely on python-neutronclient's out-of-the box ability to handle such
extensions transparently. As a result, these users become concerned
when they see the deprecation in python-neutronclient and we have no
complete story for how to support them with OSC.

This patch proposes we disable the deprecation warning in the client
until we can address the bug and have a solid story in place for all CLI
users at which point we can continue on the migration path to OSC.

Change-Id: Iafdbad590f5ffddbdd590d33e076acd70349ec50
Related-Bug: #1705755
"}]
commit_message:
suppress deprecation warning

As of today OSC doesn't support a way for plugging in client-side
code that can handle API attribute extensions as outlined in the related
bug report.

For those projects that do implement API attribute extensions, users
rely on python-neutronclient's out-of-the box ability to handle such
extensions transparently. As a result, these users become concerned
when they see the deprecation in python-neutronclient and we have no
complete story for how to support them with OSC.

This patch proposes we disable the deprecation warning in the client
until we can address the bug and have a solid story in place for all CLI
users at which point we can continue on the migration path to OSC.

Change-Id: Iafdbad590f5ffddbdd590d33e076acd70349ec50
Related-Bug: #1705755

commit_message:
use service type constants from neutron_lib plugins

The well known service type constants are in
neutron_lib.plugins.constants, but for legacy reasons a few still exist
and are referenced from neutron_lib.constants [1] that we'd like to
remove.

This patch switches references over to neutron_lib's plugin constants.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/constants.py#L353

Change-Id: I8f611cb200bcaa628a63283736af7a09f1eed038

object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the

'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value

availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

commit_message:
Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form

The value of the 'volume_type' is determined by the 'volumeType'
object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the
'volumeType' object changes. However, the current value of the
'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value
of 'volume_type' is empty, when we switch volume types drop-down box,
its value is also empty, only change the name, description, size and
availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.html#L45
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js#L140

Change-Id: If754d0c2ced844414c35829d4cefa1fb861522d5
Closes-Bug:#1737900

commit_message:
Updating for new sphinx docs jobs

There have been recent changes to how docs jobs are run under zuul [1].
This patch updates stable/pike to be able to run under the new zuul docs
jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508694/

(cherry picked from commit 967edebe0c4c1711aa6b566ed581bc33d51b611c)

Change-Id: I7ba3f7ea0b1e0733cec4e0cd3a05128c772e0238

is deleted or we can't retrieve tenant's information.

Change-Id: Idb1a5ffbb4103cce5258657d559bf4fe784b98d6
Closes-Bug: #1712565
(cherry picked from commit 65baa5fa6dbe55da06411f7e0c17af5dacfce68e)

commit_message:
Do not fail on AdminUpdateRow if tenant is not found

We still can show instance info on admin/instances page even if tenant
is deleted or we can't retrieve tenant's information.

Change-Id: Idb1a5ffbb4103cce5258657d559bf4fe784b98d6
Closes-Bug: #1712565
(cherry picked from commit 65baa5fa6dbe55da06411f7e0c17af5dacfce68e)

This effectively breaks the API without any warning, not even a release note for deployers. Why not just put a global policy rule in place in the API which can enable/disable multiattach if it's requested? Then deployers can enable it if they are using volume backends that support multiattach. Now we have to undo this either with a single revert or one by one for each driver that can opt into saying they support multiattach."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-03 20:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We wanted it one by one so each driver explicitly declares support.'}]
