commit_message:
Disable multiattach for all drivers

This patch disables setting multiattach flag to True in driver capabilities.
Since we reworked the driver attach/detach API, we need to ensure that the
issue of detaching a shared volume works properly on the Nova side.  A shared
flag might need to be required to return in initialize_connection to support
multiattach, so for now we will disable the capability.

Change-Id: I4f8229a4465d009e06de86da255f442020151113

commit_message:
Check for yum lock befor all yum* operations.

A previous (failed/hanging?) yum process blocks 'yum makecache'
 and 'yum check-update' operations, which leads to timeout during
minor update.

Change-Id: I461c1c722944813493f53f339054f420d6ddbe15
Related-Bug: #1704131
(cherry picked from commit bfe876e01c9b29f8eaf72579614b4e52d4d795b5)
(cherry picked from commit 2ae1f02e4e0d80f813e74db40ed12d7ea7cf11f6)

commit_message:
Add nfs_qcow2_volumes option

Add nfs_qcow2_volumes option to configure that create volumes as
QCOW2 files rather than raw files.

Change-Id: I968338fd8876395289028924e41d0acc1bba5e5e
Closes-Bug: #1740447

run brick-quobyteci-dsvm-volume'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-08-22 10:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Gorka,

I re-checked os-brick's code.
As a result, creating connection has been exclusived by semaphore name "os-brick-connect_volume".
So the race condition you afraid about won't occur.

I write it on commit message.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-08-22 10:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-08-22 10:36:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

The race condition can happen, and it's very likely to happen.  If you have multipath and you have 4 logins to do the code will create 4 threads to handle the 4 logins, so once the first one succeeds you'll be setting all the other 3 connections to automatic, even if they should be on manual according to the logic of the code.  You could also be setting them to automatic on the first connection, and then the login of one of the other threads will set it to manual when they start and if it logins it will be set again to auto."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-22 11:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-os-brick http://52.35.51.88/46/466146/6/check/dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-os-brick/5ca47c2 : FAILURE in 2h 07m 24s'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-08-30 07:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Gorka,

Thank you for replying!
But I have a question about your reply.

> If you have multipath and you have 4 logins to do the code will create 4 threads to handle the 4 logins, so once the first one succeeds you'll be setting all the other 3 connections to automatic, even if they should be on manual according to the logic of the code.

Are there cases which set node.startup=manual except disconnecting connections?
(And, disconnecting connections has same semaphore name "os-brick-connect_volume".)

P.S.
It is correct for iscsiadm command to change node.startup value to default value by "iscsiadm -m discovery.." command.
I asked about it to a open-iscsi developer.
refs:https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/issues/58

So I should fix this bug.
If current patch has any problems, I will think other ways.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-08-30 12:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(7 comments)

You are correct in saying that your code will have no problem with disconnect, but we could have node.startup set to manual if Cinder died while doing a connection (before actually changing it to auto) and then if the service is restarted and we do another connection your code will be changed it to auto, which will result in an undesired and unknown system device on the system, which could create problems.

Even though the scenario I'm describing is less likely to happen, I've spent a great deal of time to remove leftover devices, so I'd like to see a solution that handles both situations.

For example you could check the value of the field on all targets  before doing the discovery and right after the discovery (in _discover_iscsi_portals) you return them to auto (but only the ones that had it before)."}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-09-04 07:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Hello Gorka,

Thank you for explaining kindly.
I could understand your opinion, and I think you are right.

> For example you could check the value of the field on all targets before doing the discovery and right after the discovery (in _discover_iscsi_portals) you return them to auto (but only the ones that had it before).

I've been thinking about same idea.
I will create a new patch according to above idea.
Thanks."}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-11-28 06:33:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-11-28 06:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-11-28 06:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-19 02:01:27.000000000', 'message': 'Remove updating node.startup to "automatic"

os_brick will update node.startup from "manual" to "automatic" when
it creates iscsi connection.
But, node.startup will be reverted unexpectedly from "automatic" to
"manual" when other connections with multipath are created.
(Executing "iscsiadm -m discovery -t sendtargets -p ..." command
in creating connection with multipath is the cause of reverting
node.startup.)

In the first place, changing node.startup from "manual" to
"automatic" is unnecessary.
The components using os-brick[1] don't need "automatic".
Those will create connections when they need it without relying on
"automatic".
On the evidence, no one ever reported troubles about this bug.

So this patch removes the process of updating node.startup.

[1]e.g. nova, cinder...

Change-Id: I30b736ae3b916f77fc0778f5364c5f6ed6fecc60
closes-bug: #1670237
'}, {'created': '2017-06-27 07:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Update node.startup value without target

os_brick updates node.startup values from default value to
"automatic" when it creates iscsi connection.
But existed target's node.startup values will be reverted from
"automatic" to default value in creating iscsi connection process
if multipath is used.
Because "iscsiadm -m discovery -t sendtargets -p ..." command will
recreate all target information of specified node.[1] node.startup
value will be reverted to default value by recreating.
"iscsiadm -m discovery -t sendtargets -p ..." command will be
executed in creating iscsi connections process if multipath is used.
As a result, "automatic" targets and default value targets will be
mixed on the host.

So this patch removes specfying target from updating node.startup
command.
As a result, all node.startup values of specified node's targets
will be changed to "automatic" on the host.

[1]
This behavior was explained in following page:
https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/issues/58

Change-Id: I30b736ae3b916f77fc0778f5364c5f6ed6fecc60
closes-bug: #1670237
'}, {'created': '2017-07-10 05:52:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update node.startup value without target

But existed target's node.startup values will be reverted from

command.

In addition, changing node.startup value is done in the process of
creating connection.
And, creating connection process is exclusived by
"os-brick-connect_volume" semaphore in os-brick.
So this patch won't change node.startup value of connections
being created.

[1]
This behavior was explained in following page:
https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/issues/58

commit_message:
Recover node.startup values after discovering

os_brick updates node.startup values from default value to
"automatic" when it creates iscsi connection.
But existing target's node.startup values will be reverted from
"automatic" to default value in creating iscsi connection process
if multipath is used.
When using multipath with a discovery type of backend, the
"iscsiadm -m discovery -t sendtargets -p ..." command will recreate
all target information of specified node.[1] node.startup value wil
be reverted to default value of existing targets by recreating.
As a result, "automatic" targets and default value targets will be
mixed on the host.

So this patch recovers node.startup values after discovering.

[1]
This behavior was explained in following page:
https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/issues/58

Change-Id: I30b736ae3b916f77fc0778f5364c5f6ed6fecc60
closes-bug: #1670237

commit_message:
Skip plugins install for keystone binary builds

There should be no pip install in binary builds, move the installation
of the downloaded bits where it belongs into the 'source' install_type
section.

Change-Id: I6d8609d072d18e635250df1c1e9aa687ce1f769d

commit_message:
metadata: removed migration code to haproxy

Now that one cycle passed, we should be able to remove migration code
since we can now assume everyone already upgraded to haproxy (OpenStack
supports N to N+1 upgrades only).

Change-Id: Ic521d9ccb5d16fae322e7b0d73ae0993b67781ee

commit_message:
Add CephAnsiblePlaybookVerbosity parameter to overcloud-ceph-ansible

Add new CephAnsiblePlaybookVerbosity parameter to help user debug
Ansible runs when deploying Ceph which can take a value between 0
(default) and 5 for the amount of -v, -vv, ..., -vvvvv passed
to the ansible-playbook command.

Change-Id: I873862a0936eb2b6a318f30e5103215ef16e468a
(cherry picked from commit 9fa81be34f6afbeb0fc22c4e6f33fa571310dfe3)
Closes-Bug: #1738810

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 09:16:44.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I2aeae04a326a956b0d61b43f0baaaf437e6f9022
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I2aeae04a326a956b0d61b43f0baaaf437e6f9022

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-20 17:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecation multiattach flag on volume create

This form of multiattach was never fully supported and is now being
replaced by the new mutliattach workflow with Nova. As part of this,
volume type extra specs will be used to indicate multiattach ability
and will allow retying between volume types to change the flag after
creation.

That work is still in progress and has some potential to change. But
we know we are not going to support this old style, so we should get
that deprecated now so we can remove it and not cause any confusion.

Change-Id: Icbb9c0ca89b25620cedff6cac7a4723e7126eca6
'}, {'created': '2017-12-21 21:52:41.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate multiattach flag on volume create

This form of multiattach was never fully supported and is now being

commit_message:
Deprecate multiattach flag on volume create

This form of multiattach was never fully supported and is now being
replaced by the new mutliattach workflow with Nova. As part of this,
volume type extra specs will be used to indicate multiattach ability
and will allow retyping between volume types to change the flag after
creation.

That work is still in progress and has some potential to change. But
we know we are not going to support this old style, so we should get
that deprecated now so we can remove it and not cause any confusion.

Change-Id: Icbb9c0ca89b25620cedff6cac7a4723e7126eca6

commit_message:
Remove publish-openstack-python-branch-tarball from steth

The openstack/steth project uses the publish job in it's post however
it also uses the openstack-python-jobs template, this is not necessary
as the template defined that post job.

Change-Id: Ib239f89ad4eb94c76e1c1385715c501ef43ab57c

commit_message:
Fix grenade docs jobs

Grenade needs to run "tox -e docs", just using sphinx is not enough.
Use the tox-docs job for building since grenade does not use
requirements.

Reuse the i18n publish job and rename it so that it can be used for both
repositories - it does already what we need.

Note that the current publish job is broken, last update to
https://docs.openstack.org/grenade/latest/ was in July.

Needed-By: Ibbc60d3d6e66b7f6a850ebd9268c5b5b36c37baa
Change-Id: I6743079d4908fb4585c3714efcd0af7d4b404588

commit_message:
Revert "Replace jsonutils by ujson"

ujson isn't necessary required and ubuntu packagers raised concerned.
replace with json

Change-Id: Ia53fc9226ab7a8348bf134b3b3aaf37927398cd3

commit_message:
remove configuration from contributor guide

- move polling configuration to admin data-collection docs
- move pipeline partitioning to admin data-pipeline docs
  - add a note that it's only required for transformations
- publisher section is already in admin docs
- pipeline configuration is already in admin docs

Change-Id: Ib29ec71d835b8625b518ede98e00078e7de3d282
(cherry picked from commit 96b4d1f7e5864e0ef3a40f59b812f3cd3823f7d6)

Modify JournalPeriodicProcessor settings on tests at setUp

Instead of configuring in a per test basis, the variables needed for
tests are moved into a central place at the setUp of the test case.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 14:22:47.000000000', 'message': "remove install section from contributor guide

this is all irrelevant or duplicated:
- dbreco.rst
  - duplicates supported databases in admin-guide
  - ceilometer to gnocchi section is old and deck doesn't really
    reflect current gnocchi. also, all ocata+ docs install
    gnocchi by default.
- custom.rst
  - duplicates telemetry-data-pipelines in admin-guide
  - dups best practices in admin-guide with shuffle option
- upgrade.rst
  - upgrade is just stop, upgrade, restart for each service
  - nothing is unique except notification agent with partitioning[1]
    and existing stuff doesn't address it.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1729446

Change-Id: I2de2e7ba8789d896b19320c798150d0c4c6efe0d
(cherry picked from commit 96f346abe8138742a0f68a375e15c8321f29e3bb)
"}]
commit_message:
remove install section from contributor guide

this is all irrelevant or duplicated:
- dbreco.rst
  - duplicates supported databases in admin-guide
  - ceilometer to gnocchi section is old and deck doesn't really
    reflect current gnocchi. also, all ocata+ docs install
    gnocchi by default.
- custom.rst
  - duplicates telemetry-data-pipelines in admin-guide
  - dups best practices in admin-guide with shuffle option
- upgrade.rst
  - upgrade is just stop, upgrade, restart for each service
  - nothing is unique except notification agent with partitioning[1]
    and existing stuff doesn't address it.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1729446

Change-Id: I2de2e7ba8789d896b19320c798150d0c4c6efe0d
(cherry picked from commit 96f346abe8138742a0f68a375e15c8321f29e3bb)

commit_message:
cold resize: Adds ephemeral disk if needed

If an instance spawned without any ephemeral disks and then resized
to a flavor with ephemeral disk, the HyperVDriver currently doesn't
add any ephemeral disk to the newly resized instance.
This commit addresses this issue.

Change-Id: If4e50ced4cd3975b3f09cfe38f9df885f07f6e76
Co-Authored-By: Iulia Toader <itoader@cloudbasesolutions.com>

[{'created': '2017-12-20 09:02:58.000000000', 'message': 'nova: allow to configure libvirt/cpu_mode

For some reason libvirt defaults does not work for us on AArch64.

But to not hard code I decided to make it configurable by
nova_compute_cpu_mode variable.

Change-Id: Iad530457aef24ee8f561a8f7d2c6c6150c55bc42
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 14:22:32.000000000', 'message': "nova: set libvirt/cpu_mode on aarch64 to working value

Instance failed to spawn: libvirtError: unsupported configuration: CPU
mode 'host-model' for aarch64 kvm domain on aarch64 host is not
supported by hypervisor.

Change-Id: Iad530457aef24ee8f561a8f7d2c6c6150c55bc42
"}]
commit_message:
nova: set libvirt/cpu_mode on aarch64 to working value

Instance failed to spawn: libvirtError: unsupported configuration: CPU
mode 'host-model' for aarch64 kvm domain on aarch64 host is not
supported by hypervisor.

Change-Id: Iad530457aef24ee8f561a8f7d2c6c6150c55bc42

commit_message:
Add reset-status to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the cluster-reset-status and reset-status command.

The trove command cluster-reset-status is now:
    openstack database cluster reset status
The trove command reset-status is now:
    openstack database instance reset status

Change-Id: I8945327d244bfd2a9afe7febb7179467a8be9bd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

[{'created': '2017-11-15 16:56:09.000000000', 'message': "Log an error when using default MAAS zone

Enabling 'customize-failure-domain' with
the MAAS provider and the default zone name, the
osd doesn't get added to the crush map since 'default'
is already used as the root bucket name.

If we detect an availbility zone named 'default' from
either the config, or juju environment variable, we log
an error and return empty string from az_info().

Change-Id: I7095f977f082040756a93987631302d55ff18d72
Closes-Bug: #1729911
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 15:21:51.000000000', 'message': "Log error when using AZ with name 'default'

Enabling 'customize-failure-domain' with
the MAAS provider and the default zone name, the
osd doesn't get added to the crush map since 'default'
is already used as the root bucket name.

If we detect an availbility zone named 'default' from
either the config, or juju environment variable, we log
an error and return empty string from az_info().

Change-Id: I7095f977f082040756a93987631302d55ff18d72
Closes-Bug: #1729911
"}]
commit_message:
Log error when using AZ with name 'default'

Enabling 'customize-failure-domain' with
the MAAS provider and the default zone name, the
osd doesn't get added to the crush map since 'default'
is already used as the root bucket name.

If we detect an availbility zone named 'default' from
either the config, or juju environment variable, we log
an error and return empty string from az_info().

Change-Id: I7095f977f082040756a93987631302d55ff18d72
Closes-Bug: #1729911

zuul: Remove WSGI functional tests

Running DevStack with WSGI has been deprecated since Pike, meaning these
aren't needed any more. Remove them.

Change-Id: Ic5d7b79564efbc4f2961e4f1162ea4f3109e0caf

commit_message:
Add kafka driver vhost emulation

Emulate vhost support by adding the virtual host name to the
topic created on the kafka server. Also, update connection
management for producer/consumer.

This patch:
* updates target to topic generation
* add consumer and producer connection classes
* remove connection pool
* update driver test

Change-Id: Idd164444c04e9f465a43ee909af840a41bb090c0

log file are missing. This change notice those error and let the
test pass

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

Change-Id: Ib797a03ad0f2d36a86e633175f5d4a263796cc10

subject: Fix servicing IPv6 based TCP connections

I added an inline comment about the additional debugging output when a client connects to an IPv6 socket.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-23 17:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-24 09:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 17:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix servicing IPv6 based TCP connections

When a connection is received via IPv6, the address is a 4-tuple
instead of a 2-tuple for IPv4, so handle this accordingly.

Also handle the end of the TCP connection gracefully instead of
emitting an "Invalid packet" warning every time.

commit_message:
Fix servicing IPv6 based TCP connections

When a connection is received via IPv6, the address is a 4-tuple
instead of a 2-tuple for IPv4, so handle this accordingly.

Also handle the end of the TCP connection gracefully instead of
emitting an "Invalid packet" warning every time.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/socket.html

Change-Id: I935bbea1d58af8a5b41b5d29f12de4dcb7cf6301
Closes-Bug: 1734101
